A gripping political thriller about the 1979 rescue of six American diplomats trapped in Iran.
An authentic and absorbing portrait of a young married woman who is an alcoholic in recovery.
A visually stunning and powerful drama that teaches us much about faith.
A poignant and provocative French-language drama about the tenderness, discipline, and patience involved in being a loving caregiver.
An engrossing psychological drama about what happens in a monastery when the zealousness of faith leads to suffering and separation rather than healing and wholeness.
A witty dramady revolving around FDR and bubbling over with witty lines, colorful characters, and a hot dog picnic.
The comic misadventures of a quirky young woman who falls down seven times but gets up eight.
A strange and appealing animated film that explores the unusual adventures of a lonely boy and his eternally frisky dog.
A fascinating documentary portrait of an energetic and creative street artist from Salvador Brazil.
A documentary following Deepak Chopra, a fireball of energy, creativity and spiritual vision, on the road for a year, filmed by his son.
A disappointing potboiler from the director of Precious.
Probably the darkest movie ever made with endless scenes in shadowy rooms.
Great cast squandered in a flimsy finale.
Another in a long line of bad films set in the Midwest.
A very special coming-of-age drama with an incredible performance by Elle Fanning as a teenager who undergoes a spiritual emergency.
Portrait of a cross-generational relationship between an elderly man and a pretty young lady working for an escort service.
A rollicking drama of a New Jersey band trying to make it during the rough-and-tumble chaos of the 1960s.
A dreamlike Portuguese drama about yearning that will appeal to the adventuresome filmgoer looking for something a little bit different.
A top-notch semi-biographical drama about French writer and director Olivier Assayas's quest for the best route to self-expression in 1971.
An out-of-the-box French sci-fi flick about role-playing, power, death, city life, dreams, limos, the virtual world, and anything else you want it to be about.

A refreshingly candid and controversial documentary where former heads of Israel's security agency explain their take on the war against terrorism and express their criticism of the nation as a police state.
A documentary about a rich couple riding the waves of wealth and greed and then plunging downwards.
An astonishing drama set in Africa that vividly depicts the courage and resiliency of a 12-year-old girl whose spiritual gifts enable her to survive.
A playful flick about two female vampires, city life and the huge role of screens in our lives.
A satisfying and gratifying ending to the journey of Edward and Bella that summarizes all the lessons we've learned from them.
movie_title: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn Part 2 (2012)

movie_review_blurb: A double whammy about the crusade of a big-hearted boy who helps homeless children and a depiction of the plunge of a mother and her son into poverty.
An intriguing documentary about a young man, his close encounter with the world of spirits, and his quest for peace and transformation.
A riveting tale of survival about the adolescent daughter of two Nazis in post-World War II Germany.
Another mesmerizing thriller from Steven Soderbergh set in the world of Big Pharma and the widespread use of antidepressant drugs.
A documentary charting the extraordinary life and work of Mumia Abu-Jamal from his prison cell over the last 30 years.
A tribute to poet and publisher Lawrence Ferlinghetti as a creator and nurturer of wonder.
A waste of the talents of Melissa McCarthy and Jason Bateman.
A garish supernatural story.
An authentic study of the loneliness of a closeted gay man and his struggle to break free from this prison.
A compelling Chinese coming-of-age drama about a young boy's initiation into the adult world of violence and mystery.
Portrait of a wealthy woman with a sharp mind who struggles to find her way out of passionless marriage into a life of her own creation.
An exquisite and sense-luscious French film about the great artist and his last muse.
An emotionally vibrant story of the scourge of terrorism, the nightmare of fundamentalism, the dangers of zealots of all types, and terrible results of xenophobia.
A lucid and prophetic documentary that will rekindle your passion for making your small contribution to saving the planet.
A psychological thriller that explores fresh territory in its depiction of sexual politics.
A talky French film where a woman, her present boyfriend, and her former lover do a dance of desire and disdain as they each try to work out what they really want
movie_title: Me, You and Us (Un Enfant De Toi) (2012)

movie_review_blurb: A documentary about the shocking extent of hunger in America, affecting 1 in 4 children.
A powerful and thought-provoking drama about war. peace, and the challenges of cross-cultural understanding.
A bold and refreshingly original French film about story, writing, imagination, creativity, sexuality, and breaking rules.
A very impressive concert displaying Leonard Cohen's melancholy songs and his Zen courtesy to his musicians.
An extremely violent mess of a movie.
A teenage immigrant from France living in Israel and a Palestinian youth try to break down the barriers that separate them.
movie_title: A Bottle in the Gaza Sea (2013)

movie_review_blurb: A healing and hopeful dramady about friendship. love, family, and optimism that is one of the Best Films of 2012.
A fascinating portrait of the marriage and creative partnership of Alfred Hitchcock and his talented wife Alma Reville.
A remarkable Irish drama about a homeless man living in his car whose friends help him get unstuck.
A character-driven gangster drama exposing the shadow side of America as nothing more than a business ruled by money, power, and violence.
An unusual 3D tale about a playful free spirit who is thrilled to become a Guardian who watches over children.
A drama filled with the same kind of emotional fireworks that animate the gripping familial interactions in works by Arthur Miller and Eugene O'Neill.
A holiday drama that depicts the miracle of forgiveness in the midst of a storm of familial conflict and misunderstandings.
An Israeli drama about a father-daughter reunion that is twisted by lies and high expectations.
A frolicsome, funny, and thought-provoking film about a couple's midlife crises and how it affects their marriage, their family life, and their sense of themselves.
A French animated film about the unusual quest of a rabbi, a skeikh, and a talking cat to discover the essential unity of life.
Three cheers for a sentimental musical about forgiveness, freedom, and love that brings tears to our eyes in unison with others!
A riveting documentary about the case that went all the way to the Supreme Court and legalized interracial marriage in 1967.
Yet another battle-filled and self-indulgent film by Peter Jackson.
A clinical, single-minded revenge film that prioritizes technique over morality in the war on terrorism.
A first-rate drama about a family vacationing in Thailand when the 2004 tsunami hits.
A snapshot of the nonconformist Beatniks of the 1950s who yearned for the freedom and pleasures of the open road.
A laser-sharp documentary about a grisly crime, the unjust imprisonment of three innocent young men, and the first crowd-sourced investigation in history.
A meditation on aging and the possibilities for transformation of four retired opera singers in a retirement community.
The superb latest addition to the documentary series by Michael Apted, following the lives of 14 people in England.
A shocking and poignant documentary about the Catholic Church's cover-up of sexual abuse and the victims who heroically came forward to break their silence.
movie_title: Mea Maxima Culpa: Silence In The House Of God (2012)

movie_review_blurb: A character-driven drama about some baffling changes in the lives of a middle-aged brother and sister.
An unhappy suburban wife and mother seeks to move her life into turn-around through sexual pleasure.
A bold and vivid exploration of the sexual desire of two middle-aged female friends.
A psychological thriller about a sex therapist and her efforts to stay in control of her life.
A creative and thought-provoking interpretation of the Noah story as a parable about second chances, the excesses of zeal, and the blessings of mercy.
The journey of Cesar Chavez from migrant worker to American hero as a nonviolent labor leader and civil rights activist.
A hard-hitting documentary about oil, money, globalism, international finance, corruption and greed.
An eerie and austere film charting the nightmarish response of the French sculptress to her imprisonment in an asylum.
A creative and touching story about a romantic, wise, and witty vampire couple; one of the best films of 2014.
A disappointing and depressing finale to a sex addict's journey.
A siren from another planet appears in Glasgow, Scotland on a special mission that challenges her sexual allure and desires.
An oddball comedy about a screwed-up 28-year old stand-up comic who tries to get her life back on track after learning that she is pregnant.
An elegant and enlightening portrait of the life and ministry of Father Thomas Keating, one of the towering figures on the global spirituality scene.
movie_title: Thomas Keating: A Rising Tide Of Silence (2014)

movie_review_blurb: A charming, funny and oddball drama about a gentle, quiet, and sensitive florist who knows how to give women pleasure.
A very imaginative take on modern romance and the yearning of lonely and isolated twentysomethings for an intimate relationship.
An affecting, gentle, and illuminating portrait of children's spirituality.
A touching drama based on a short story by Alice Munro about a housekeeper who takes a leap of faith.
A delightful portrait of a year in the lives of a family of brown bears.
A sci-fi thriller that is carried into our consciousness by Rebecca Hall's heartfelt and nuanced performance.
A meditation on death about two young brothers dealing with the sudden death of a friend and all the other losses around them.

A heart-wrenching documentary that reenacts the journey of a Honduras migrant who died in the Arizona desert and the compassionate actions of those who identified his body and provided closure for his family.
A sports dramedy that really clicks thanks to a vibrant performance by Kevin Costner.
A sign-of-the-times movie about two desperate brothers in modern day Israel who kidnap a rich girl in a desperate attempt to get some economic equity
A fascinating dystopian tale about a multi-talented young woman who faces many challenges as she tries to remain true to her rebellious character.
A documentary about the reclusive photographer Vivian Maier that is a bit weird and wonderful.
A complex spiritual and psychological drama set in France and India where two married couples struggle with mysteries they cannot comprehend or control.
A creative examination of the important role of solitude in a troubled marriage.
A mesmerizing psychological thriller set in the majestic Swiss Alps.
A delightful dramedy and road movie with Catherine Deneuve at her best.
An enlightening documentary about classes in France offered to immigrant children before they enter regular schools.
A thought-provoking moral thriller about a euthanasia activist in Italy.
An appealing psychological love story with superb performances by Annete Bening and Ed Harris.
An out-of-the-box French film about a couple who have never heard of kiss and make up and try other more violent strategies to reach across the abyss that separates them.
A witty, face-paced and audacious comedy about French diplomacy, politics, and the peculiarities of power.
A Portuguese working-class couple who give all they've got to their employers must rearrange their priorities when they come into a large inheritance.
A delightful French dramedy about young love, middle-age, and the continuing quest for an intimate and lasting relationship.
movie_title: Au bout du conte (Under the Rainbow) (2013)

movie_review_blurb: A likeable drama about an eleven-year old who survives living on his own in the forest but finds it more difficult to get by when he returns to civilization.
A dark comedy about the toxic speech of an angry, nasty, and self-destructive man.
A lethargic caper comedy about two feuding brothers who get together for one last heist.
A creative, daring, and enlightening documentary about the twists and turns taken by youth who during the last century sought to find their place in a confusing and war-despoiled world.
A map of the dis-ease of Argentina's wealthy people whose minds are awash in fear and paranoia.
A vivid and wonder-inducing example of everyday spirituality during one day in the life off a family in a Berlin apartment.
A dank and dour drama contrasting the woes of a sad sack loser to the triumphs of an ambitious and self-confident winner.
A creative drama about a female sex addict whose adventures are a tuning fork for ethics, philosophy, intimacy and loneliness.
An intense, well-acted drama of one middle-aged man's dark night of the soul where his choices come back to haunt him.
A madcap, inventive, and wonder-inducing creation about the arts of living from the inimitable writer and director Wes Anderson.
A low-budget sci-fi thriller with worthwhile questions about the relationship between human beings and super-intelligent robots.
A historical drama pieced together when two sisters discover things they didn't know about their parents' life in post-World War II France.
A complex sci-fi tale about war, warriors within, and resetting the day.
movie_title: Live Die Repeat: Edge of Tomorrow (2014)

movie_review_blurb: An innovative and engrossing French romantic comedy.
A sobering look at the battle between Soviet military overlords and a band of courageous freedom fighters.
A triumphant biopicture about an immensely creative bisexual woman who has been called France's greatest unknown writer.
A documentary about a Maine recluse who at 76 years of age makes public appearances as the icon of the Burt's Bees brand.
A grim portrait of an agent for young actors who takes his best shot at success in the nasty and venal Hollywood film community.
An impressive sequel that leaves us cheering for the noble ideal of animals and humans living together in peace and harmony.
A dumbed-down comedy that descends into a bad soap opera.
A poignant and heart-affecting love story about two teenagers squaring off against death.
The struggle of a Swedish theology student turned crusading journalist to speak truth to Hitler's power while dealing with his own shadow side.
A sobering and idealistic call for more emergency room "mercy medicine" as an alternative to treating only paying patients.
A biopicture about the pop music group worth seeing for the playful and melodic songs.
A sad drama set in Corsica about class warfare, youth, and greed.
A spunky and sad story of the toll of obsessive love on a musician.
A romantic drama that captures and conveys the healing power of music.
A dystopian masterwork illustrating the moral rot of dividing the population into a winning class versus everybody else as poor scum of the earth.
One of the best and most memorable films ever made about the art of improvisation as a path of wisdom, creativity, and personal renewal.
A poignant documentary on five-year battle of LGBT community to gain marriage equality in California.
Three intimate dramas that test our beliefs and attitudes about trust.
An entertaining dramedy about love, loss, middle age, and the art of acceptance.
A comedy clinker set in the old Wild West.
movie_title: A Million Ways to Die in the West (2014)

movie_review_blurb: A documentary about a 450-mile pilgrimage through the Himalayas to spread the message of environmental compassion.
A French dramedy about the love affair that brings pleasure to a married 64 year old woman and a 41 year-old computer teacher.
An appealing comedy about food, career transitions, and the bonding between a busy father and his 10-year-old son.
A madcap comic extravaganza revolving around a feud between a suburban couple and the fraternity next door.
Portrait of a pioneer of multiple religious belonging.
A documentary that sings the praises of a founder of the Julliard Quartet, a violin virtuoso, teacher, and composer.
movie_title: Speak The Music: Robert Mann And The Mysteries Of Chamber Music (2014)

movie_review_blurb: An engrossing family drama about a 14-year-old girl's coming-of-age during a spa vacation with her father and younger brother.
A documentary focusing on six pilgrims and their responses to this daunting and enlightening physical and spiritual journey.
movie_title: Walking The Camino: Six Ways To Santiago (2014)

movie_review_blurb: An enlightening Danish documentary about one of the world's most famous and creative human rights activists.
A delightful French film about a writer, his many female friends and lovers, his adventures in Manhattan, and his yen for being a good father.
A touching and humorous Canadian documentary about teenage mentors who teach a group of elders how to use computers and the Internet.
A superb sports drama about the spiritual transformation of a sports agent.
A character-driven drama about the ways the past intrudes on the characters' perceptions of what is possible for them.
A charming German romantic comedy about the adoration of writers and the perks of literary stardom.
A heist-caper comedy with Emma Thomson and Pierce Brosnan as a winsome couple on a grand adventure to recover their love and much more.
A romantic comedy filled with epiphanies about love and the ways in which the creative process can be revived by soulmates.
A summer blockbuster that surges with creative action sequences and memorable characters.
Three female teenagers trying to stick together in a world that is stacked against them in Stockholm, circa 1982.
A thriller that charts the dark places in the hearts of idealists who become zealots.
A riveting drama about three years in the early AIDS crisis and the struggle of a gay writer fighting the indifference of so many people to this epidemic in New York City.

An eighteenth-century costume drama that lights up the screen with a beautiful mixed race heroine, an idealistic law student, and a circle of older English aristocrats whose most cherished traditions are challenged.
An extraordinary Indian movie about love, loss, and yearning.
A spiritually literate animated film for people of all ages that affirms that everyone is special and everything is truly awesome.
A nightmarish and heart-wrenching documentary about fear, paranoia. greed, and an indictment of the juvenile justice system.
The story of a man prone to escape the present moment through fantasies who is transformed when he discovers his courage.
movie_title: The Secret Life Of Walter Mitty (2013)

movie_review_blurb: A stirring drama set in Palestine where an intense young man experiences the torment of distrust in his private and public life.
A superb Chilean film about the quest of two middle-aged divorcees for lasting love.
The harrowing story of a Polish nurse who struggles to survive and keep her soul alive in 1921 New York.
An immersive drama about being resilient and facing the fear we all have of dying alone; one of the Best Films of 2013.
One of the Most Spiritually Literate Films of 2013 about a son who takes his irritable dad on the road and in the process opens himself to truly honoring his father.
A Charles Dickens biopic directed by Ralph Fiennes with fetching costumes and a well-acted romantic drama.
A wild and weird romantic story about the intimate relationship between a lonely man and his computer operating system who calls herself Samantha.
A soul stirring tale of survival in outer space and an astronaut's spiritual journey.
A creative and well-acted story about the explosive firepower of sexual desire as a tricky force that can bring both gratification and frustration, sweetness and bitterness, pleasure and pain.
Drama about the controversial information freedom fighter made worth seeing by Benedict Cumberbach's tour de force performance.
A scary documentary about the efforts of the Christian right to achieve in Uganda what they believe is their God-given right to lead that African nation.
One of the best films of 2013 with its focus on the quest for freedom and the desire to escape the prisons of oppression, violence, and merciless power.
An impressive and wide-ranging documentary by Frederick Wiseman looking at the daily happenings at a major American university.
Tour de force performance by Matthew McConaughey as a working-class hero who is part scumbag and part whistle-blowing crusader for AIDS victims.
A documentary about a bold African woman in Rwanda whose efforts to renew her community pay off.
A chilling and compassionate documentary about the plight of runaway children in Karachi, Pakistan, and an elderly humanitarian who has created centers to look after them.
A morality play that doesn't work.
A compelling documentary by Jonathan Demme that makes an altar out of our ears.
Steve Coogan in a frisky English comedy that clicks.
A solid portrait of a middle-aged caption of a hijacked cargo ship man who possesses the right stuff for surviving a hellish four-day ordeal.
A sobering drama about racism and slavery that will sear your soul and set you thinking about the shadow side of American history.
A courageous and creative little girl in the oppressive and patriarchal Saudi Arabian society expresses her rebelliousness and tries to fulfill her dreams.
Revelations about Salinger's arrogance, romantic escapades with much younger women, mania for privacy, writing bunker, and many secrets.
A glimpse of a Nigerian couple living in Brooklyn who are trying to get pregnant.
An unhappily married American woman's affair in Italy sets her on a new course in her life.
A sensitive and intelligent documentary about the compassion and heroism of four doctors.
The spiritual journey of a Palestinian teenager from a refugee camp in Beirut in 1982 and an Israeli pilot captured by the PLO.
A snappy and crowd-pleasing documentary about eight players in the World Golf Championships for children 8 and under.
Four sex addicts in recovery supporting each other, sharing the pain, taking it one day at a time, and seeing change as a process, not an event.
A well-done and enlightening documentary on income inequality in America featuring Robert Reich and his take on this deepening crisis.
A comedy that proves that succeeding in an intimate relationship after divorce takes the patience and kindness of a saint and the creative daring and courage of a mountain climber.
A start-to-finish winner by director Ron Howard about two race car drivers who start out as enemies and after many years find themselves in a place that neither of them could ever have imagined.
The strange spiritual journey of a young porno addict who shifts his perspective and is set on a different path.
The life, work, and love story of an aviation engineer in Japan prior to World War II directed by Hayao Miyazaki.
A documentary about a cable car route that teaches us how incredibly rich and varied the sameness in our lives can really be.
A witty and insightful drama about the challenges of a long-lived marriage, including old resentments, wounds, disappointments, secrets, and sexual problems.
A thought-provoking drama that depicts the baby steps a pretty young South Korean woman takes as she begins to deal with the breadth and depth of her loneliness.
movie_title: Nugu-ui ttal-do anin Haewon (Nobody's Daughter Hae-Won) (2013)

movie_review_blurb: An appealing Japanese film about the slow and surprising transformation of a self-absorbed father and distant father.
A combination romantic comedy and time travel movie that reveals what comes from a spiritual appreciation of the present moment and all its delights.
A chronicle of the spiritual retrieval of a lost man's soul through the work of psychoanalyst/anthropologist.
The quest for sexual fulfillment of a lesbian housewife.
A sobering documentary focusing on Mariel Hemingway and her struggle with the terrible curse of seven suicides in her family history.
John Sayles drama about three marginal Americans who cross the border into Mexico to find a kidnapped African-American man.
Mark this one as a clinker.
A moving, candid, and intimate documentary filled with many magical moments.
Another vibrant film directed by David O. Russell that is bursting with colorful characters, funny scenes, and standout performances.
One of the best documentaries ever made on Alzheimer's which has been called the disease of the century.
A hard-hitting documentary exposing the cruel underworld of sex trafficking of teenage girls.
A heart-affecting tale of survival with a fierce and tender performance by Martina Gedeck.
A midde-aged professor's life is transformed by a philosophical book that falls into his hands and propels him on a quest from Switzerland to Portugal.
An over-the-top portrait of a cynical head of brokerage firm which vividly shows the soul rot afoot in America.
Story of super-soldiers in Afghanistan, a failed mission, and two surprising act of mercy in the midst of all the bloodshed.
Drama that brings us face-to-face with the toxins that can destroy marriages and family life.
The story of three lonely and vulnerable people who forge their own improvised family over a five-day period.
A relatively alluring period drama set in an artist's colony in Cornwall in 1913.
A tour de force performance by Maxine Peake as an energetic, vibrant and loving Irish wife and mother dealing with a tough transition at home.
An appealing film reveals the bright side of retirement for three men.
A rare and illuminating glimpse of contemporary Hasidic life against the backdrop of ritual, Purim, marriage, and death.
A delightful romantic comedy about two middle-agers learning the hard lessons of letting go.
A morally cogent film based on a true story that lifts one's spirits.
A tour de force performance by Luminita Gheorghiu as a controlling mother trying to blast her way back into the life of her thirty-something son.
An unconvincing and unappealing comedy.
An intense but bungled love story that focuses on the middle-aged angst of a controlling father.
Entertaining story of the tenderizing of a critical and persnickety writer.
A nifty time-travel thriller that hits the mark.
An Iranian film about the close encounter of a woman unlucky in love, her unhappy children, her ex-husband, and her new lover.
A hybrid sci-fi story and horror flick that starts with banality and never recovers.
A poignant documentary about the love and support needed by victims of multiple sclerosis.
An important documentary that will inspire you to help save Inuit communities and the sea ice ecosystems in Hudson Bay.
A blistering critique of the exploitation of performing orcas in marine parks.
An impressive documentary on the guitar artistry of John Fahey who described himself as a spiritual detective.
movie_title: In Search of Blind Joe Death: The Saga of John Fahey (2013)

movie_review_blurb: A startling documentary about life in Acre, an Israeli city on the sea filled with unhappy Palestinians who have lived there for generations.
A spiritual drama about the dynamics of faith, forgiveness, hope, and love; one of the Best Films of 2013 with an Academy Award caliber performance by Judi Dench.
A teenage girl as a hero in-the-making animated by her feisty independent spirit, survival skills, selflessness, and courage.
Oh my, look at the density and stretch of this MIT linguist!
movie_title: Is the Man Who Is Tall Happy?: An Animated Conversation with Noam Chomsky (2013)

movie_review_blurb: A couple's struggle with grief after their six-year-old daughter is diagnosed with cancer.
A 3D animated princess tale saluting sisterly love and female empowerment.
An inspiring biodrama about the art of leadership pioneered by Nelson Mandela based on love and forgiveness.
An extraordinary documentary about a cowboy who models the spiritual practice of reverence.
movie_title: Running Wild: The Life of Dayton O. Hyde (2013)

movie_review_blurb: An animated film that has it all: captivating characters, rich thematic material, humor, imaginative visuals, and an adventuresome quest.
Animated film about monster college students competing to become the scariest one of them all.
A drama in which we watch a good man crumble and descend into darkness.
An overweight 13-year-old girl's exploration of her sexual yearnings while attending a "diet camp."
The struggling quest of a folk singer to find out whether or not he has the right stuff.
A deft and fascinating documentary about art, technology, and the creative spirit.

Five years in the life of a couple who must improvise their marriage and family life when he is in prison, learning that difficulties in marriage are opportunities to discover ever deeper reserves of love.
An imaginative Japanese animation film about a resilient single mother trying to prepare her two strange children for the world.
movie_title: Okami kodomo no ame to yuki (The Wolf Children Ame and Yuki) (2012)

movie_review_blurb: A wonderful and quirky film about two quite different seventy-somethings and their adventures during a trip to Iceland.
An engaging drama that shows how courage and compassion can change lives in the twinkling of an eye.
A hard-hitting attack on the medical establishment and the pharmaceutical industry's continuing attacks on alternative therapies.
Another around-the-bend black comedy that doesn't work.
A terrible documentary that has sheds very little on the Bernie Madoff Ponzi scheme scandal.
A valiant and touching psychodrama about an aging woman who takes on the challenge of writing her first poem from the experiences that stir her heart.
A cross-cultural gem that opens our eyes, minds, and hearts to people in remote regions of the world.
An overcooked espionage thriller celebrating revenge.
A spiritual masterwork about the friendship between a Muslim and a Jewish boy and the ways in which it brings unexpected changes into their lives and faith perspectives.
Powerful portrait of how civil war transforms the lives of children in a Colombian farm community from a carefree existence to one of fear and growing up too fast.
A derivative and unappealing drama about four girls at a boarding school.
A dramatically inert and poorly acted French film.
Boring diversions dilute this drama about a man with miraculous healing powers.
An absorbing, nuanced, and intelligent film about a global pandemic in which Soderbergh shows how the battle against a deadly virus draws out the best and the worst in human beings.
A hard-hitting documentary which poses the harrowing questions: Where are the soldiers who served in the Afghan war going and what will ever become of them?
An inventive Norwegian comedy that depicts the redemptive power of an extramarital affair
A quiet, meditative, and spiritual Italian film about the transmigration of the soul.
An offbeat and ruminative drama about two young people and their mutual obsession with death and dying.
A somber but creative Russian drama about death, sex, friendship, and the lingering effects of an ancient pagan culture.
A tender and touching love story in a small French town where two unlikely people connect in an appealing and magical way.
movie_title: La tête en friche (My Afternoons with Margueritte) (2011)

movie_review_blurb: An engrossing portrait of the public and private lives of Jane Goodall; one of the Best Documentaries of 2011.
A lively and fascinating glimpse of the Black Power Movement and its messages for America.
A delightfully funny film about a modern-day holy fool who brings chaos into the lives of his three sisters while opening their hearts at the same time.
A spiritual drama that challenges viewers to map their own journey of faith, asking questions, having doubts, and seeking a closer connection with God.
A highly focused and well-directed French psychodrama set in the corporate world where power plays and competition can lead to disastrous events.
A romantic comedy that fails in its exploration of friendship and sex.
A tedious star-spangled World War II drama.
An ambitious drama that aims too high and isn't able to connect all the pieces of the puzzle it presents.
A sparkling and well-acted comedy about three generations of characters seeking the holy grail of love and pleasure.
A rousing action drama that mixes film genres and comes up with a winner propelled by strong performances by Daniel Craig and Harrison Ford.
A riveting documentary about three committed, sensitive, and compassionate warriors for peace whose heroism has made a difference in the lives of people in inner city Chicago.
One man's dark night of the soul brought on by civil war in Chad.
Profiles of three very young participants in a prestigious Koran recitation contest in Cairo.
A sci-fi thriller that touches the heart and is sure to create many new and enthusiastic animal activists.
movie_title: Rise of the Planet of the Apes (2011)

movie_review_blurb: A compelling true story about the transformation of a female Nebraska cop into a heroic whistleblower in Bosnia in 1999.
A character-driven cross-cultural drama about the adolescent quest for new experiences and the realization of the mysteries that lie behind relationships and reality.
A tribute to African-American maids in the South during 1963 and their courage in telling their stories as a form of grace under pressure.
A vigorous documentary putting on display the youthful energy, talent, and respect for diversity of the singing and dancing cast members of TV's popular Glee series.
A compelling documentary about a champion Formula One driver and his unusual life of passion for the sport.
A tender love story on many levels that will soften your heart with its sweet surprises.
An enchanting coming of age story set in France in 1763 and focusing on the creative quest of Mozart's older sister, a talented musician.
An intimate, rounded, and realistic documentary about a charming, hard-working couple who are Tibetan nomads.
A portrait of American imperialism set in an occupied village during the 1900 Philippine-American War.
A contrived portrait of two friends who wonder whether they would be better off as lovers.
Story of a beautiful and talkative parrot who proves to be a miracle worker bringing two lonely souls together for a quest that changes them both.
A new storytelling genre -- a crowd-sourced documentary.
A thinking person's sports flick about the impact of the maverick Oakland Athletics General Manager on the game of baseball.
An extraordinary documentary about an educational project instituted by two Tibetan Buddhist monks who want to enrich the lives of 17 impoverished children from their region.
A winning and thought-provoking sci-fi thriller set in the future that taps into some of the most troubling inequities and problems of our era, the lack of time.
A razzle-dazzle animated feature about an outlaw cat who dances flamenco and is a survivor able to handle all challenges before him.
An unusual and enlightening documentary about Tibetan Buddhism, impermanence, a popular spiritual master and his son, who has been designated as the reincarnation of a famous lama.
Abigail Breslin in a shining performance as the responsible one in a father-daughter reunion.
An exploration of the spiritual challenges of membership in a religious cult that is obsessed with the end of the world and an escape to paradise.
A sophisticated documentary in which veteran actress Charlotte Rampling talks about her career, art, and aging.
A serious and meditative film about loss, mourning, and the changes that come with them.
A biopic about the early adventures of Goethe at work, in love, and creating his first masterwork.
An intriguing look at Tudor England and the Bard who caught the spirit of the times and the heights and depths of the human adventure.
A caper comedy which will appeal to all those who want to see a Wall Street wheeler dealer get what he deserves.
A glimpse of the glory and the loss in the rise to power of Nicholas Sarkozy, the president of France.
A documentary on capital punishment filled with small and humble human touches.
A mind-blowing end-of-the world drama that challenges us to take stock of our beliefs, feelings, and fears about death.
A documentary on the life and artistry of the 20th century's first virtuoso violinist.
A biopic about the director of the FBI for 50 years whose legacy is today's us-versus-them approach in public life.
An obnoxious and self-absorbed little girl tries to cope with a down-scaled life.
A down-and-out small-time criminal tries desperately to get his act together.
movie_title: The Last Rites of Joe May (2011)

movie_review_blurb: A masterful and emotionally rich movie about the grief of parting and the agony of separation in the life of a father whose losses lead to new and transformative connections.
Story about two young lovers whose patience, resilience, and trust are tested when they are separated for a long period of time.
The extraordinary true story of a social worker who exposed the notorious forced deportation of children from England to Australia from the 1940s to the 1970s.
A magical Finnish film about the miracles that a warm heart can work in a world of hatred and divisiveness.
An intense drama about human trafficking and the yearning for freedom.
An ethically-charged courtroom drama about a David vs. Goliath battle.
A heart-affecting drama about the loving relationship between a lonely and alienated boy and a badly injured dolphin and the community that supports them.
A powerful film about a dying mother who gifts her daughters with advice as a form of ethical will.
A 1941 Disney animated feature about a harassed little elephant with big ears and his friendship with an imaginative mouse.
A touching portrait of a courageous young man's journey with cancer and the varied responses of the people around him.
A provocative documentary that sheds light on the reasons why teachers deserve higher salaries so they can flourish in the classroom doing what they love to do best.
A multidimensional film featuring commentaries from writers and filmmakers on how Joseph Campbell's hero's journey finds expression in our lives.
A creative and fascinating documentary on dust.
A combo political thriller and morality play that is thought-provoking and brilliantly performed by some of America's best actors.
A group of true believers in the American cause in the Afghanistan war and what happens to one of them when he comes home injured.
A documentary about the emotional upheavals of the Oscar-winning stars of Once during their world tour.
Story of how a middle-aged Paris stockbroker's life is transformed after he goes gaga over his Spanish maid and all things Spanish.
movie_title: Les femmes du 6e étage (The Women on the 6th Floor) (2011)

movie_review_blurb: A lively and rambunctious remake of the 1984 classic about a rebel with a cause who loves to dance.
A thought-provoking thriller and Gothic horror story directed by Pedro Almodovar.
A combo documentary, memoir, and probe of technology that offers a creative look at the brave new world of interdependence and collaboration.
movie_title: Connected: An Autoblogography About Love, Death & Technology (2011)

movie_review_blurb: An enjoyable comedy about three avid birders who wind up as competitors on a quest to see who can spot the most species of birds in North America
An unrelentingly grim drama about yet another dysfunctional family.
A floundering comedy with banal messages about putting family first.
A thriller where the rich prove their survival skills in a clash with thieves who invade their luxurious home.
A poignant English coming-of-age drama about a stubborn and angry boy and the stepmother he can't abide.

The best animated film of 2011 with its quirky characters, lively dancing, soaring songs, and the heroism of many different animals banding together in face of an eco-disaster that threatens them all.
An emotionally rich dramedy about the transformation of a very troubled 35-year-old wife and mother who is felled by several crises beyond her control.
An amateurish and unappealing documentary about participants in a 197-mile relay race.
An emotionally affecting coming-of-age drama set in the 1960s about the importance of the many splendored virtue of respect.
The spiritual journey of a disabled turntable dj with a gift of healing from Skid Row to megabuck success as a member of a heavy metal band.
The German cinematic explorer Werner Herzog leads a 3-D tour of the Chauvet Cave which houses art that is 30,000 years old.
An uplifting drama set in Kenya about a caring and hospitable teacher who takes under her wings a 84-year-old man enrolled in her school to learn how to read.
A bittersweet drama about a cross-generational friendship that proves beneficial to a teenage outsider who is sinking into isolation and severe loneliness.
A playful and witty take on the traditional coming-of-age dramas.
A wonderful mockumentary that provides plenty of laughs and chuckles - a hoot from start to finish.
Maria Bello and Michael Sheen carry this poignant drama into our hearts and minds with fierce integrity and authenticity about a family struggling to deal with an unimaginable tragedy.
True story of thrill-seeking photojournalists in South Africa just before the historic elections.
Drama about the many challenges faced by an earthwork artist from Kansas as he takes on a project in New York City.
A quirky but emotionally affecting drama about depression, beaver medicine, and the miracles of love and transformation.
An appealing and universally relevant drama about the dynamics of death and loss within the family circle.
A flat and uninvolving documentary about Yves Saint Laurent.
A tedious marital morality play with superficial characters.
An entertaining and thought-provoking documentary that offers a global examination of longevity, centenarians, and the growing market for anti-aging products.
A shattering film about the 1937-1938 Nanking massacre and the atrocities committed by Japanese soldiers who treated Chinese soldiers and civilians as subhumans.
The most hilarious comedy of the year boasts a sensational performance by Kristen Wiig as a vulnerable and stressed-out woman who loses it all during the wedding preparations
A suburban sales executive reaches a dead-end and must re-evaluate his life while practicing the salutary art of letting go.
In this Peruvian film, an isolated male lone shark and a devout Catholic woman yearn for miracles to turn their empty lives around during a religious holiday.
A zany and thought-provoking documentary about the omnipresence of advertising in our lives and the large role of product placement in movies.
movie_title: POM Wonderful Presents: The Greatest Movie Ever Sold (2011)

movie_review_blurb: The struggle for survival in Kenya of a wild cheetah and her newborns and an elderly lioness and her cub.
The screen adaptation of a bestselling novel that is both a magical carpet ride about circuses and a parable about loving and learning from animals.
A poignant drama about a vulnerable teenage girl, a manipulative pedophile on the Internet and a loving father who is forced to wrestle with his explosive emotions
An elegant and inspiring French drama about a chambermaid who follows her passion for chess and finds her life transformed.
A documentary that presents a long-needed overview of Eastern spirituality in our time with its emphasis on prayer, silence, and living icons.
A tepid sci-fi thriller.

Those who were enchanted by the flying sequences in Avatar will experience the same exhilaration here as Hiccup rides Toothless between mountain peaks. Equally uplifting is the father-son reconciliation which is handled with just the right emotional heft.
An inspiring true portrait of Raoul Wallenberg, one of the most exemplary individuals of the twentieth century, in an Emmy Award-winning drama that originally aired on NBC as a four-hour mini-series.
A funny and deft portrait of the self-absorbed world of those involved in creating Broadway plays.
A helpful and healing documentary for families about the work of two woman who are caring for orphan elephants and orangutans.
A meditative Western that focuses on the spiritual transformation of a female settler into a leader as she journeys West in a covered wagon caravan.
A well-done thriller with fairy tale sequences, a surprising secret, and a 16-year-old girl who soldiers into the world.
The true story of a talented Hawaiian surfer who demonstrates great courage in the face of a setback to her dreams and discovers how she is meant to serve.
An exquisite screen version of Rebecca West's 1918 novel.
An unappealing recycling of the 1981 romantic comedy.
A poignant and ethically-charged courtroom drama about yet another overlooked and forgotten abomination from America's past.
A mesmerizing romance morphs into a thriller and then a psychodrama about a foreign-born maid and her relationship with a security guard.
A chilling documentary about Danish soldiers fighting the Taliban in Afghanistan during their tour of duty.
An examination of the possibilities for Mars-bound astronauts in terms of space suits, foods, and rockets needed for a two-three year journey.
A NOVA scienceNOW report on the latest research on animal intelligence with segments on dogs, wolves, dolphins, octopuses, and a talkative bird.
movie_title: How Smart Are Animals?: Nova Sciencenow (2010)

movie_review_blurb: A boring animated feature about birds, smugglers, and an unlikely couple.
Profiles two lesbian sisters who as popular singers in New Zealand have advanced liberal causes among their country music fans.
An absorbing drama about Jewish persecution, the sting of guilt, and the struggle for survival.
Documentary following six teenage magicians as they compete for the title of Teen World Champion.
An inspiring documentary, one of the best films of 2011, about what beekeepers and other sensitive souls are doing to save the bees who have been leaving their hives and dying in large numbers.
movie_title: Queen Of The Sun: What are the Bees Telling Us? (2011)

movie_review_blurb: A clever and creative French comedy about an unlikely couple trying against all odds to make a life together.
movie_title: Le nom des gens (The Names of Love) (2011)

movie_review_blurb: The engrossing story of the heroism and compassion of a 12-year-old South African who demonstrates selfless love in caring for her very ill mother.
An engrossing Iranian film about the familial clash of values of a sister seeking freedom and pleasure and a brother who is zealot for Islamic fundamentalism.
A comedy that wants us to cheer for a nasty and self-absorbed teacher who breaks all the rules.
A too long and repetitious sequel to the winning first film that is part Cars, part James Bond, part Transformers, and part Beverly Hillbillies.
An amateurish and tedious romantic drama about two irritating people and two flip cameras.
Two screen superstars can't pump any authentic life into this shallow drama.
Tedious portraits and flat observations about love by couples and singles in New York City.
An engrossing documentary about the heroic 25-year pilgrimage of a loggerhead turtle.
A silly and inconsequential drama about three girls on a trip.
An astonishing documentary about a chimp raised as a human and the calamitous consequences.
A well-done documentary on the life and work of Yiddish writer Sholem Aleichem, a masterful chronicler of Jewish culture.
movie_title: Sholem Aleichem: Laughing in the Darkness (2011)

movie_review_blurb: A beautiful and beguiling Australian film about love, loss, mystery and the resources needed to hold together a grieving family.
A down-to-earth and whimsical screen interpretation of three A. A. Milne inspired tales about fear, friendship, and the importance of play.
An illuminating documentary about dumpster divers fighting food waste.
The final installment of Harry Potter's journey into spiritual maturity as a selfless magician who is willing to sacrifice himself for others.
movie_title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows - Part 2 (2011)

movie_review_blurb: A wild and weird Errol Morris documentary about the stories we tell ourselves to cope with life's disappointments.
Yet another slam on an amoral Fundamentalist preacher.
A drama about the clash of faith between a zealous Christian fundamentalist and a non-believer with a zest for life.
A touching and authentic immigrant tale that touches the heart and is One of the Best Films of 2011.
At long last a vibrant, emotionally rich, relevant, and timely documentary about a progressive Unitarian Universalist minister and the challenges she faces in her public and private lives.
A disappointing film that gets mired down in the clichés of previous comic book superheroes on the screen.
An underwhelming pirate saga.
movie_title: Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides (2011)

movie_review_blurb: A bold and challenging film about a journey from stardust to wonder that stirs the soul as it sets the story of the creation of the universe alongside the intimate story of one family in the 1950s.
A fine family film about an orphan who finds a satisfying new life in the countryside of Ireland.
A bittersweet Israeli road movie about the difficulties of putting other people first.
Gospel music to stir the soul, shake the rafters, and express devotion and gratitude to God.
An unusually gratifying film about a playful 75-year-old man's zest for life and its effect on his serious and lonely 38-year-old son.
A hard-hitting documentary about the detrimental effects of cowboy capitalism on Appalachian communities and their majestic mountains.
A palatable and appealing prequel to the popular mutant superhero series.
A cogent documentary exploring the causes of the global disappearance of honeybees who play such a crucial role in our ecosystem.
A hard-hitting documentary about the activities of the Earth Liberation Front which has been labeled by the FBI as the nation's Number 1 domestic terrorism threat.
An edifying 1983 documentary about the yearning for freedom by the persecuted and downtrodden Mayan peasants of Guatemala.
An extremely disturbing Canadian documentary about the plight of a young detainee at the notorious detention camp.
movie_title: You Don't Like the Truth: 4 Days Inside Guantanamo (2011)

movie_review_blurb: A fluid and well-acted Dutch film about the adventures of three women and their quest for happiness in the exotic new world of New Zealand.
A documentary about Flora a retired circus elephant that turns into a complex and compelling meditation on interspecies relationships; one of the Best Films of 2011.
A hard-hitting documentary about the activities of the Earth Liberation Front which has been labeled by the FBI as the nation's Number 1 domestic terrorism threat.
movie_title: If a Tree Falls: A Story of the Earth Liberation Front (2011)

movie_review_blurb: An extraordinary documentary about a horse-whisperer whose spiritual messages and healing techniques are good medicine for all.
A sensuous tribute to the city of Naples and the emotional undertow of its diverse musical traditions.
A spunky coming-of-age drama that reveals that this transitional stage of life is not a solo act but a communal one requiring the encouragement and support of many different people.
A sophisticated documentary that provides a behind-the-scenes look at the challenges faced by The New York Times as it struggles to survive in a new media environment of intense competition.
movie_title: Page One: Inside the New York Times (2011)

movie_review_blurb: A Woody Allen classic with Paris as an enchanting backdrop, some appealing characters, and a potpourri of witty one-liners.
A satisfying culmination of emotions that have been building in this supernatural fantasy saga as Bella the human and Edward the vampire marry and face a critical decision.
A tiresome and irritating melodrama about an extended family gathering for a wedding and showing their neurotic sides without any restraint.
A free-flowing and enchanting celebration of movie-making, finding the way home, and the kind of caring that can transform the lives of others.
A romantic comedy about two sisters and their friend with three top-drawer and dazzling performances.
A peppy screen version of the Broadway musical that will get you humming along to your favorite 1980s pop and rock songs.
A respectful and creative treatment of sex and the mysteries of love by director Sarah Polley with a stunning performance by Michelle Williams.
A disturbing, hard-hitting, and emotionally-shattering documentary about the rapes of women serving in the U.S. military.
A spiritually challenging documentary about guru-disciple relationships and taking responsibility for our own spiritual growth and maturation.
A multi-story film with warnings about the dangers and delusions of love, marriage, fame, and the need to control everything that shows up in our lives.
A powerful and poignant waiting for the end-of-the-world film that revolves around the quest of two people to find love as the best shelter against the impending disaster.
movie_title: Seeking a Friend for the End of the World (2012)

movie_review_blurb: An extraordinary movie about a fearless six-year-old African-American girl who tutors us in the art of survival; one of the best movies of 2012.
An entrancing French romantic comedy about the continuing heartbreak of a woman trying to start over after being ditched by her longtime boyfriend.
The scattered adventures of a talking teddy bear and his best bud.
An eloquent and compelling documentary on the dire effects of light pollution in cities and the spiritual consequences of not being able to see the bright starry sky at night.
A chance to see whether you are a skeptic or a true believer in psychic phenomena.
A documentary about the sad and lonely women around the world who depend on romance novels for cheap thrills.
A robust and poignant screen adaptation of Thomas Hardy's Tess of the d'Urbervilles reset in India.
The funny adventures of two little guys who enter the tricky world of politics with nothing but passion and a dream.
Character-driven drama about two estranged sisters who reach a point where they must choose either reconciliation or permanent separation from each other.
A disappointing fourth installment in the Ice Age franchise
An engrossing Israeli drama about an extraordinary young Russian Jewish woman who always puts others first and is a nurturer par excellence.
A spiritual film for all true believers in the power of love to transform lives.
An unappealing melodrama with a lethargic performance by Robert Pattinson.
An exploration of the challenges of letting go of a long and intimate romantic relationship.
A combo science-fiction horror film and quest drama exploring the origin of our species.
A comedy about the struggle of two people in love to keep their relationship alive as a work-in-progress.
An emotionally rich and nuanced performance by Juliette Binoche as a woman journalist experiencing a sexual crisis.
A top-drawer dramady about a band of English retirees in India and the challenges and transformations they undergo.
A creative film from Chile about love, books and bonsai.
A charming and inventive Japanese movie about wishes, questing, friendship, sibling solidarity, and the wonderful support of grandparents when we need them the most.
An intimate and well-acted drama about the technological tools in our lives and the quest of a young pregnant woman to reconcile with her long estranged mother.
A Russian domestic thriller set in Moscow where the gap between the rich and the poor has grown into an abyss.
A sizzling French drama about a courageous team of men and women in a Parisian Child Protection Unit who struggle to survive the daily deluge of crime and chaos.
A heart-affecting Japanese film about a patient, skilled, and loving seeing-eye dog and his brief life of service.
movie_title: Quill: The Life of a Guide Dog (2012)

movie_review_blurb: A wonder-inducing film from Wes Anderson about the authentic quest of two oddball teens who just want to be free.
A character-driven story that resurrects this entertaining franchise.
A playful and compassionate French film about an unconventional caregiver and the quadriplegic man he looks after.
A stoner comedy that runs out of gas.
An unappealing and operatic screen adaptation of the Brothers Grimm fable.
A very under-developed French animated thriller that fails to engage our emotions.
A wonder-inducing combo of time travel and romantic comedy that tickles the funny bone and provokes thought about the different dimensions of time.
Story of a mother-daughter reunion and its transformative impact on both women; another triumph from veteran Australian director Bruce Beresford.
Heart-breaking story of a 35 year old suffering from the toxins that loneliness and isolation can serve up.
The 1968 animated classic by the Beatles as their declaration of independence.
A formidable examination of the roles of superheroes in our society and the importance of purpose in life.
An inventive drama about a gregarious assistant funeral director in a small Texas town where he is widely cherished.
Profile of a Muslim woman preacher who runs a school where young girls memorize the Qur'an and learn the practices of their faith.
Profile of a gentle, caring, and sensitive man who models for us the empathy and respect we should have for all animals large and small.
movie_title: The Wild Parrots of Telegraph Hill (2005)

movie_review_blurb: Visually stunning documentary about the importance of sacred sites in Buddhism.
An earnest and edifying documentary on the philosophical and ethical ramifications of debt as something owed.
A derivative and unimaginative glimpse of friendship and the phone-sex business.
Don't allow this doctor to treat you.
Portrait of punk rock singer/songwriter experiencing a spiritual emergency as he copes with a deluge of trouble and disappointments.
A sad and cogent documentary about young girls exploited by the modeling industry.
An engrossing and well-acted screen adaptation of a 1973 novel by Nobel Prize-winning author Patrick White about a dying matriarch and her two spoiled adult children.
While a slacker upends the quiet life of a printer and his young wife, neighbors begin a crusade to rid the area of the homeless and other foreigners.
Six vulnerable and appealing characters on a quest to escape the prison of their loneliness.
A drama about a thirtysomething woman stuck in a rut and yearning to be set free.
An ethically revealing film about a New York billionaire who's a member of the winning-class.
A fetching drama about a high school class reunion with some magical moments.
A fascinating drama about the mysterious relationship between a cult leader and a wayward and violent disciple.
An extraordinary and universal Italian film about a 60-year-old man's mid-life crisis and the sapping of his spirit.
movie_title: Gianni e le donne (The Salt of Life) (2012)

movie_review_blurb: The rousing coming-of-age journey of a shy, smart, and sensitive high-school freshman who emerges from his shell to savor life.
movie_title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower (2012)

movie_review_blurb: A spiritual drama that puts two faces on Mexican poverty and then makes it possible for us to see these characters as our brother and sister rather than as strangers.
An uplifting drama about two young men - a Jew and a Palestinian - that waters the seeds of empathy in our hearts.
An uplifting drama about two young men - a Jew and a Palestinian - that waters the seeds of empathy in our hearts.
A romantic drama about a relationship based on ideas and ideals between an enthusiastic college student and a 35-year-old college admissions counselor.
A bold documentary about the corruption, ineptitude and power of Mexico's justice system where police and judges have a vested interest in rigorous pursuit of law and order.
A riveting documentary about the spiritual uses of saunas by Finnish men.
A documentary that makes a good case against the building of five large dams in Chile designed to make a profit for European investors.
A deeply moving documentary about love, living with disabilities, savoring the senses, and being present.
Top-drawer documentary about the art and activism of a Chinese artist who yearns for freedom.
An inspiring and uplifting documentary about a man who gives all he's got and experiences a miracle in return.
A movie about guys and aliens that is scattered in too many directions.
The trials and tribulations of a Texas family that nobody would want to spend any time with.
A funny and sensitive movie about the renewal of a burnt-out marriage that is one of the Best Films of 2012.
A moving chronicle of the slow but steady changes put into motion by the first openly gay Episcopal bishop in America.
A sensitive and lovely portrait of the slowly unfolding friendship of two preteen girls in America - one from Israel and one from Vietnam.
A follow-up to the romantic 2 Days in Paris, this farcical comedy revolves around familial and cross-cultural clashes.
A slam-bang out-of-the-box comedy probing the sorry state of politics in contemporary America.
Interesting takes on espionage tools of drones, genetics, and surveillance.
A straight-forward documentary about the life and work of the visionary known as the father of the modern state of Israel.
movie_title: It Is No Dream: The Life of Theodor Herzl (2012)

movie_review_blurb: An enthralling non-narrative documentary with images from five continents that becomes a guided meditation on the wheel of life and death; one of the best films of 2012 that you will treasure all your life.
A clunker from an immensely gifted filmmaker.
movie_title: The Odd Life of Timothy Green (2012)

movie_review_blurb: A delightful animated feature with special appeal for tree lovers.
Story of the slowly evolving relationship between a mannered robotic caretaker and a cantankerous old man.
An overwrought Iranian film about a self-destructive artist.
Low-calorie stories about two women who are unlucky in love.
A tribute to a wolf who was raised by a loving couple to become an ambassador for her species.
A romantic fantasy that offers a few new twists on romantic relationships and the need to control another's moods, needs, and activities.
An ethically rich and bold documentary on the 100 year old kibbutz movement in Israel.
movie_title: Inventing Our Life: The Kibbutz Experiment (2012)

movie_review_blurb: Another excessive melodrama based on a novel by Nicholas Sparks.
Another documentary teaching children a dualistic view of the world with good versus evil communities.
A 3-D adventure thriller about the quest of two greedy souls to find a lost treasure of gold.
A spellbinding drama about a heroic horse, the young man who loves him, and the kind handlers who help the horse during the hell he endures on the battlefields of World War I.
An amazing and appealing 3D documentary by the inimitable Wim Wenders on the innovative dancer and choreographer Pina Bausch.
A poignant and emotionally literate film about the wise stewardship of pain by a precocious teenager mourning the loss of his beloved father.
An enlightening documentary about a multi-talented married couple who have been called the most important American designers in the 20th century.
movie_title: Eames: The Architect And The Painter (2011)

movie_review_blurb: A powerful coming-of-age drama about a creative and inexperienced African-American lesbian who tries to be true to herself.

An Academy-award caliber performance by Meryl Streep as Margaret Thatcher the Prime Minister revealing how her refusal to compromise trashed a nation and increased the gap between the rich and the poor.
A striking musical documentary about rock singer and songwriter John Mellencamp and the changes overtaking this musical genre and the heartland of America.
An exploration of the nature of heroism and sacrificial love during the Japanese occupation of Nanking in 1937, from acclaimed Chinese director Zhang Yimou.
An impressive performance by Brendan Gleeson as an eccentric, independent and surly cop in a small Irish seaside town.
A modern-day version of the Shakespeare play about the toxic results of rage, starring and directed by Ralph Fiennes.
A suspenseful story about a depressed oil refinery worker in Alaska who leads six co-workers struggling to survive after their plane crashes in the wilderness.
A unbelievable thriller with a surfeit of unappealing characters.

A thematically rich drama about the efforts to save three trapped whales that speaks volumes about cross-cultural misunderstandings, media circuses, and the good that can rise to surface when opposing groups work together.
A scary and sad movie about a victim of bullies who becomes what he hates most when he gets some mysterious superpowers.
An extraordinary French film about the emotional education of a couple with a seriously ill infant.
A deeply spiritual love story that challenges us to be fully alive to the report of our senses and to live in the present moment which will never appear again.
The true story of a selfish Polish man whose caring for a band of Jew living underground in sewers during World War II qualifies him for recognition as a Righteous Gentile.
A biopicture about the formative early years of one of Brazil's most famous presidents whose muse and advocate was his beloved mother.
An odd but endearing drama about a meticulous waiter in 1898 Dublin with a gigantic secret and expansive dreams for the future.
A Western about a cowboy vagabond who learns that you can't go home again.
A sports movie about a martial arts tournament and an intimate drama about letting go of hatred and opening the heart to the healing balm of forgiveness.
A cerebral trip with Jung and Freud, sex and cigars, the talking cure and adventures beyond.
One week in the life of a lucky young man who is befriended by the sweet angel of sex and has the time of his life.
An edifying documentary on the life and times of the controversial Tibetan Buddhist spiritual teacher and spiritual warrior whose mission was to build an enlightened society.
Another family holiday flick that disappoints rather than delights.

An astonishing documentary about the life and work of scientist and eco-activist David Suzuki who shares his elder wisdom about science, nature, conservation, and the right path of indigenous peoples.
movie_title: Force of Nature: The David Suzuki Movie (2011)

movie_review_blurb: Involving portrait of two couples meeting to smooth out the rough edges of a mutual problem who wind up letting loose all the anger, disappointment, and hatred inside themselves.
An intense portrait of a sexual addict in New York City whose life revolves around satisfying his libido and conquering women.
A dramady about beauty and change in the life of an attractive messed-up woman.
A clever and thought-provoking French comedy about two people who are thrown together: a working-class single parent and a high-finance superstar who makes money the easy way.
A fine and fluid French drama about the enchantments of first love and the challenges of moving beyond it despite its beauty and meaning.
movie_title: Un amour de jeunesse (Goodbye First Love) (2012)

movie_review_blurb: An unsettling drama with a chilling portrait of a destructive mother-and-son relationship that eventually impacts the lives of others.
movie_title: We Need to Talk About Kevin (2012)

movie_review_blurb: An engaging morality play about the quest of an English woman and an African Muslim to find their children after the 2005 terrorist attack in London.
A failed attempt to revive John le Carre's espionage novel for a new audience.
A mildly humorous tale set in northern China about a project designed to bring more beauty to a disgustingly ugly environment.
movie_title: Gang de qin (The Piano In A Factory) (2010)

movie_review_blurb: A sequel that betters the original by focusing on relationships and the battle between the Zen master of attention and the fiend of chaos and darkness.
movie_title: Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows (2011)

movie_review_blurb: An emotionally literate film about a grieving family trying to jump-start their lives again by running a small zoo for animals.
A searing Iranian film about divisiveness as a toxin in relationships.
One of the best Mission Impossible flicks with several adrenaline- pumping action sequences.
A dark thriller that mines the meanings of family skeletons, power, corruption, sex, and misogyny.
movie_title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo (2011)

movie_review_blurb: An enlightening documentary about the revolution wrought by Muhammad Yunus and the Grameen Bank's micro-finance loans to the poor.
movie_title: Bonsai People: The Vision of Muhammad Yunus (2012)

movie_review_blurb: A Spanish animated film for adults that is a real crowd-pleaser.
A touching drama about memory, loss, and reclaiming love.
An inspiring documentary about a caring coach of a losing inner-city football team.
A dreary and unappealing film about a couple of messed-up New Yorkers and what they choose to do just before the end of the world.
A searing portrait of a young man's chronic loneliness.
A remarkable documentary which charts the impact on a Palestinian village, and one of its children, of Israeli oppression during the past five years.
A documentary on the impact of a passionate group of dedicated and creative individuals in raising awareness of the AIDS epidemic.
Poignant story of a nineteen-year-old at a Austrian juvenile detention center who gets a probation job at a morgue and begins inching toward a new life.
An inspiring portrait of a passionate female freedom fighter and an exquisite love story set in the darkness of violence, repression, and tyranny in Burma.
This retelling of the famous Grimm fairy tale tries too hard to be funny.
An eye-opening documentary that focuses on five youth who were bullied, including two who committed suicide, and how their families, schools, and communities respond.
A most clever and unusual campus comedy about a female crusader and her special missions.
A thought-provoking documentary on the major crises of our times brought on by an uncritical acceptance of the idea of progress.
A mesmerizing drama about a lonely and malevolent man's possible spiritual transformation.
A light-hearted comedy about the Vatican and the Papacy under pressure due to a surprising development.
Plenty of raunchy and funny scenes but not enough character development.
An unappealing comedy about a friendship between two women that is put in jeopardy when one of them has a child.
The violence in Chile in 1973 when the government of Salvador Allende was overthrown seen through the eyes of a mortuary assistant.
A comedy about the changes and the challenges faced by a couple entering the far country of old age.
An under-whelming sci-fi thriller.
A Lawrence-Kasdan directed dramody about how a lost dog helps a long-married couple find their way back to each other.
An astonishing documentary charting the life and legacies of reggae superstar Bob Marley.
1950s story about an alluring woman who leaves her husband in search of sexual passion with a younger man.
A well-acted and winning drama about a dysfunctional family, baseball scouting, and conscious aging.
An endearing romantic drama about a creative young Puerto Rican with a passion for dance.

An insightful documentary about the director's disturbing, painful, and conflicted relationship with her mother.
A compelling French dramedy about the yearning of a woman who is passionate about opera music.
A mildly entertaining comedy about the adventures of two English princesses on the evening of V-E Day.
One of the year's best, an emotionally rich lesbian love story.
A documentary tribute to the career of the director Alfred Hitchcock.
A heavy bag of cliches from precious action dramas and sci fi features.
A dramedy about a rock musician seeking to reconcile with the family she left behind to follow her bliss.
Drama about the losing battle of a politician seeking to take in the good.
A thought-provoking documentary about an unusual homeless man in Manhattan.
A timely and thought-provoking documentary about efforts in China to deprogram teenagers addicted to Internet gaming.
A riveting documentary that will bring your blood to a boil when you see how Africans are being exploited once again.
Heartwarming HBO documentary about love and compassion at work in Tibet.
A comedy about two stepsisters finding ways to support each other during a period of transition in both their lives.
A biopicture charting one man's painful and then rewarding mission to become a writer.
A character-driven comedy about a transition point in an elder's life where she is forced to look at all her relationships.
A futuristic story about three people struggling to survive in a world they could never have imagined.
A splendid and engaging morality play about class warfare and the challenges and disappointments of parenting.
movie_title: The Second Mother (Que Horas Ela Volta?) (2015)

movie_review_blurb: Americans abroad in peril of death.
A moral drama with plenty to teach us about the difficulties of living an ethical life.
A German morality tale about a shy and fastidious cleaning woman whose curiosity takes her to places she does not expect to go.
A delightful chance to savor the acting skills of veteran film stars Robert Redford and Nick Nolte.
A radiant, subtle, and engrossing story about the blossoming friendship between a New York book critic and an Indian-American driving teacher.
An impressive Chinese melodrama about love, reconciliation, and the multiple meanings of home.
A poignant drama about marital love where husband and wife go their separate ways to confront their gods and demons.
A content-rich and visually impressive animated film presenting eight profound and poetic wisdom teachings.
A documentary about the exchanges that started the trend of shouting matches passing themselves off as political talk.
A French dramedy about a Senegalese immigrant with a stunning performance by Omar Sy.
A melodramatic love story propelled by a rousing batch of 80s pop hits.
An emotionally rich drama that conveys the sunshine and shadows of the elder years.
movie_title: I'll See You in My Dreams (2015)

movie_review_blurb: Touching portrait of an Aboriginal elder who is determined to live the old ways.
An intense screen version of Flaubert's novel about a woman who is devoured by her desires, high expectations, and disappointments.
An intensely focused, emotionally gripping, and beautifully acted antiwar movie.
Story of the love/hate relationship between the Welsh poet Dylan Thomas and his tour-agent during his first visit to America.
An astonishing dramedy about life, death, and the mysteries that imbue them both.
movie_title: Me and Earl and the Dying Girl (2015)

movie_review_blurb: An animated masterpiece that helps us understand, appreciate, and re-frame our emotions.
A touching and inspiring film by an Israeli director that fosters the spiritual practice of open-mindedness.
A stirring morality play about creating community, leading others, and having respect for one's enemies.
A spiritual movie for practicing empathy and compassion for fearful fundamentalists.
A celebration of little words that can make a big difference.
A heart-rending drama about drone warfare that proves there never has been, and there never will, be "a good kill."
A tender romantic drama about two music lovers who face steep and unruly challenges during hard times.
A delightful and informative documentary on delis, Jewish food, and the tricks of the trade.
A multi-genre story that starts with a bang but ends with a whimper.
A rousing 3-D sci-fi adventure that celebrates the teamwork between a man on an important mission and a band of insects.
Magical story about a man who emerges from a river to look after a farmer's daughter, the rainforest, and a stunning jaguar.
Another content-rich dramedy based on a bestseller by John Green.
A poignant portrait of a homeless man who has fallen from grace and is struggling to survive.
A richly developed drama about an autistic teenager's coming-of-age as he begins to connect emotionally with others.
An astonishing three-hour film with many voices expressing the best and the worst of humanity.
A kids-in-jeopardy flick drenched in comic slurs on old people.
A powerful cry from the heart to respect the rights of young boys and end their enslavement in war.
An enchanting costume drama about beauty, flowers, love, grief, and impermanence.
A friendly drone in this sci-fi feature comes across as a modern-day equivalent of R2-D2 in the Star Wars sagas.
A vibrant and enlightening survey of the life and work of one of the world's most renowned art collectors
A richly emotional character-driven drama.
An engrossing film about the transformation of a working-class mom into a radical feminist in 1912 England.
A charming documentary about a long-married Hollywood couple who made many important contributions to American movies.
movie_title: Harold And Lillian: A Hollywood Love Story (2017)

movie_review_blurb: A hard-hitting documentary on the complexities of creating a workable democracy in Africa.
A poignant drama that will leave you yearning for the kind of transformation that takes place near the end.
A heart-affecting immigrant love story with a genuine and poignant performance by Saoirse Ronan.
A documentary about the photo revolution that has taken place in Afghanistan during the past decade.
A grand finale for the series in which the characters deal with the spiritual question: What is the truth?
Sad story about the struggles of two brothers from Burkina Faso who journey to Italy in hopes of finding a better life.
An astonishing Turkish drama about the oppression of five spirited young women whose sexuality frightens the Muslim elders in the community.
A tender and touching biopicture on the life and spiritual work of Mother Teresa who viewed herself as an instrument of God's love.
A Canadian documentary about songbirds as another species at risk.
A dinosaur with a good heart, learns the meaning of courage on his way home after many adventures.
Reports from cities around the world about the need for bikes and the problems faced by bikers.
One last case for the elderly detective that convinces him to cherish the mysteries of his existence.
A hard-hitting morality play about foreclosures, the pursuit of wealth, and the courage it takes to do the right thing.
An Israeli dramedy about euthanasia
The 24th Bond film in which the macho hero addicted to peril must choose between the path of revenge or love.
A bold exploration of some of the challenges faced by investigative journalists in an age of dirty politics.
A riveting drama that takes us into territory previously unexplored in gangster movies.
A cogent and playful documentary about the banned filmmaker's return to the streets of Teheran.
A pleasant dramedy about work and a cross-generational friendship.
A call to speak out against the neglect of those with untreated mental illness.
A science fiction gem that includes a tribute to the importance of little things like duct tape.
