A daring film about the passion, the gratitude, and the beauty of an amazing stunt.
A thought-provoking and ethically-charged documentary about the Apple computer entrepreneur.
movie_title: Steve Jobs: Man in the Machine (2015)

movie_review_blurb: An enchanting cinematic work of art that turns a martial arts drama into a meditation on beauty and empathy.
Tense drama with a standout performance by Emily Blunt as a conscience-driven FBI agent on a dangerous hunt for a Mexican druglord
A touching portrait of a shy 16-year-old whose life is transformed by her encounter with an outsider.
A thought-provoking film about obedience to authority figures.
A terrific Spielberg portrait of an American hero whose zeal for justice is awesome.
A harrowing portrait of the virulence of racial hatred in a small New York community.
The true story of a landmark case about abduction for marriage in Ethiopia that stands up for the dignity and rights of women everywhere.
A pleasant documentary about three adolescents trying to represent the U.S. in table tennis at the 2012 Olympics.
An alluring drama of love and loss that will bloom in your consciousness and soul.
A healing and helpful medical documentary with fresh insights on the importance of the patient-physician relationship.
A conscience stirring documentary about two Christians and their crusade for gun control.
A convincing affirmation of investigative journalism and a ringing condemnation of sexual abuse by Catholic priests.
A fascinating documentary that immerses us in a diverse and lively Queens neighborhood where community activism is alive and well.
Interesting episodes on robots, small cars, electricity, earthquake detection, and a pioneer in synthetic biology.
An appealing drama set in Wales in 1976 about a high school rock opera version of Shakespeare's The Tempest.
A bungled sequel to the original snappy comedy.
movie_title: Diary of a Wimpy Kid 2: Rodrick Rules (2011)

movie_review_blurb: Magically transports us to the sensuous setting of southern France where memory, love, and a grand fondness for place conspire to alter the life of a selfish London trader
An engrossing drama where transformation is the holy grail sought by a woman determined to change her life.
Enables us to ride the waves of emotion during Beethoven's premier performance of the majestic Ninth Symphony and to savor the composer's spiritual perceptions of his music.
Another triumphant, playful, and deeply spiritual animation classic by the Australian genius behind Babe; this one will set your feet in motion and stir your soul.
A bold muckraking movie that attacks the fast-food industry, corporate malfeasance, workplace safety, and the plight of Mexican immigrants and working class people.
A well-acted and thought-provoking anatomy of love and marriage that includes many universal challenges and obstacles.
A very funny satire on the Hollywood hype machine and the worthless junk it spews into the universe about movies.
A poignant and heart-rending drama about the hopes, dreams, anger, and righteous indignation of those who saw in Robert Kennedy a catalyst for justice, change, and peace in America.
An alluring psychodrama about Diane Arbus that celebrates freaks, the start of something completely different, and the liberation that comes when soul mates share their innermost secrets.
movie_title: Fur: An Imaginary Portrait of Diane Arbus (2006)

movie_review_blurb: An Australian drama about two lovers addicted to heroin that offers no fresh insights into this obsession.
Surprisingly thin gruel considering all the fuss over the theatrical presentation.
A complete surprise: Joseph comes across in this Biblical drama as a more engrossing and mysterious character than Mary.
A light-hearted and feel-good independent film about two strangers who connect in a way that surprises both of them and enriches their lives: it's one of the best films of the year.
Three riveting dramas about the AIDS crisis set in South Africa, China, and Canada that open our eyes and our hearts to victims of this dread disease.
A high-tech thriller that reaches too far with its themes of time travel and a life-saving miracle.
One of the best films of 2006 -- opens our eyes to the bloody brutality of civil war, corporate malfeasance, and the training of child soldiers.
A special coming-of-age drama that explores loneliness, a cross-generational friendship, and the spiritual importance of listening.
A relaxed and enjoyable film from Argentina about a young man who is in no hurry to move out from under the shadow shed by his father, a popular and successful lawyer.
A spiritual movie set in three centuries about death, the tree of life, the fountain of youth, and love that will not let us go.
An engrossing and beautifully acted remake that salutes horses, freedom, and familial love in ways that stir the heart.
Suffers in comparison to the tension, subtlety, and top-drawer acting in Infernal Affairs.
A documentary about the comedian and satirist who sees himself as a leftward leaning crusader for Truth and Justice in an era of Lying Liars.
A moody and sobering portrait of the end of a romantic relationship between an older man and a younger woman.
A thought-provoking documentary that gives us a new appreciation of the time, energy, and hard labor that lies behind the creation, packaging and delivery of the food we eat.
A mesmerizing performance by Kirsten Dunst as Marie Antoinette, a self-absorbed woman imprisoned in a golden cage of wealth and privilege.
A richly developed French film about university life, power, deceit and mentoring that presents quite a moral wallop.
Filipino film set in a shantytown where poverty breeds anger, hatred, and violence in its residents.
A relentlessly grim and violent film that blends a redemptive fairy tale with a glimpse of the horrors of war in 1944 Spain.
A tender and touching film about the blooming of love, the poignant tug of place, and the challenges of openness in a rural Midwest community in the 1920s.
This dazzling and spellbinding tale about the intense rivalry between two magicians in London tutors us in the art of watching closely.
Delivers the dramatic goods and compels us to rethink our ideas about heroism in World War II and the exploitation of soldiers as hucksters for the war effort.
A zany movie about young lives whacked and warped by the excessive craziness and irresponsibility of adults.
A multidimensional story that explores what happens when love is ignored, squandered, or annihilated by anger, alienation, hatred and violence. One of the best films of the year.
A thought-provoking depiction of the process whereby self-righteous zealots who use barbaric tactics and torture to achieve their goals actually create more terrorists.
A fictional documentary that presents many of the divisive shadow elements afoot in our combative and xenophobic American culture.
A rousing documentary that salutes freedom of speech and the resiliency and creativity of the Dixie Chicks.
movie_title: Dixie Chicks - Shut Up and Sing (2006)

movie_review_blurb: A touching Australian film about the healing and liberating powers of imagination and love in a besieged family and a divided mining community.
A small and intimate English film about playing cricket, coming of age, and the respect for diversity that seems so hard to learn.
An engrossing award-winning documentary about the chaotic and bloody situation in Iraq as seen through the eyes of Sunnis, Shiites, and Kurds.
An unpretty picture of the 2004 Presidential election campaign animated by big money, power politics, negative campaign ads, and hatred.
A hard-hitting documentary in support of Fair Trade focusing on the tireless efforts of a manager of a coffee grower's cooperative in Ethiopia to get members more money for their labors.

An astonishingly vivid and violent film about the waning days of a Mayan civilization that turns into a meditation on the shadow side of life, forcing us to own up to human savagery and to realize how desperately we need peace as a counter-balance.
A fine coming-of-age drama about a sexually eager young man who discovers that anything is possible with a friend who is loving and trustworthy after years of giving and forgiving.
A thought-provoking and ethically-charged film that greatly expands our moral understanding of the act of stealing.
A sad depiction of how courageous North African soldiers fighting for France during World War II were treated shabbily by their superiors.
A top-drawer screen adaptation of a Newbery Award-winning novel about two children who become friends and use their imaginations to transform their everyday world.
An inspiring drama directed by Michael Apted about a zealous abolitionist in eighteenth century England who models for us a moral heroism.
An exuberant movie about a dreamer whose passion and zeal lights up his life and unifies his family behind him.
A riveting fact-based drama about an American spy who betrayed his country and at the same time was a devout Catholic.
A poignant and emotionally gripping story of a Bosnian single parent struggling to survive in Sarajevo and carrying deep physical and spiritual wounds from the 1990s wars.
A charming French film about the yearnings of an ordinary young woman and the rich and famous celebrities she encounters in her job as a waitress at a famous Paris bistro.
An intimate and well-realized coming-of-age drama about two Israeli teenagers doing obligatory military service in Jerusalem.
The only thing shocking about this French film is its Puritanical finale.
Not even the considerable charm of Grant and Barrymore can make this trivial and predictable romantic comedy shine.
Superficial comedy about the coming-out of a young woman.
An astonishing film about a Bengali family and their experiences in Calcutta and Manhattan as they deal with divided loyalties and yearn for love, freedom, and meaning.
A thought-provoking documentary about the difficulty people have with the spiritual practice of forgiveness.
An endearing comedy about the spiritual transformation of a rigid, shy, and lonely I.R.S. agent whose life is upended by forces beyond his control.
A poignant drama about Ireland in the 1920s and the violence that tears apart the fabric of community and pits brother against brother.
movie_title: The Wind That Shakes the Barley (2007)

movie_review_blurb: A wonderful sci-fi tale that proclaims that the emotions, compassion, and wonder of children may hold the key to the survival of future generations.
An engrossing and well-acted film about two men who find a way to help each other and demonstrate the rewards of friendship.
A psychological thriller with the message that knowing about your impending death has a way of focusing your life and making everything supercharged with meaning.
An elegantly constructed and acted French film about revenge and what is lost in the act of bringing others down.
movie_title: The Page Turner (La Tourneuse de pages) (2006)

movie_review_blurb: A psychological thriller that is a murky mess.
A riveting German film about spying and the fear, distrust, and betrayal that come with it.
An unfunny comedy about an interfering mother and a dysfunctional family that demeans women big time.
A spiffy romantic comedy with an appealing and sparkling performance by Elizabeth Reaser.
A delightful and enchanting screen version of the children's classic by E.B. White about friendship, the awesome power of words, and the real life of the imagination.
A hard-pressed African-American single parent and his five-year old son struggle to survive and fulfill the American dream in San Francisco in 1981.
A compelling drama about a traumatized young woman who keeps to herself and finds a way out of silence by sharing her secret with someone who cares.
A beautiful and very believable story, set in China in the 1920s, about the personal transformation of a married couple.
Peter O'Toole in an Academy Award caliber performance as a veteran actor who opens our hearts to the bounties of a life animated by kindness and pleasure.
An inspiring story that shows how sports can be a healing force in times of loss and grief.
A portrait of a future society that spotlights the issues we need to be addressing today.

The 1981 Broadway musical lumbers onto the screen saddled with clichés from every showbiz story ever made about the rags-to-riches saga along with songs that can't hold a candle to the Motown classics.
A predictable and not-bold-enough account of the struggles of a band of National Guard soldiers after returning home from the war in Iraq.
A visually sumptuous action drama by Zhang Yimou, who proves himself to be the Busby Berkeley of our times.
A total downer and disappointment given writer and director Karen Moncrieff's poignant debut with Blue Car.
A well-acted drama about the genesis of the CIA and the zealous patriots who made it into a powerful agency animated by fear and paranoia about our enemies and distrustful of everyone.
A riveting and disturbing drama about the friendship between two women and the desperate things loneliness will drive us to do.
A delightful and enchanting biopicture about the famous children's book writer and illustrator whose love of the English Lake District made for a dramatic legacy.
An inspiring drama about an idealistic teacher who breaks down the walls separating her students from each other and enables them to celebrate their unity in diversity.
A gritty Russian movie about a plucky and adventuresome orphan who sets out to find his birth mother.
An inspiring documentary about three immigrants from the Sudan and their strong connection to their African roots and values.
In her directorial debut Susannah Grant has made a romantic comedy that flounders and fizzles with bad acting and unappealing characters.
A thought-provoking documentary about Ralph Nader as a zealot for justice, consumer rights, and meaningful democracy.
A murder mystery, a love story, and a glimpse of the beginning of conflict between the United States and Russia following the defeat of Germany in World War II.
Yet another movie selling violence and revenge as the answer to our political problems.
A political comedy with spunk that capitalizes on several bizarre trends in contemporary American politics.
The sad story of how shamanism and the ancient ways of the Inuit was replaced by Christianity and a hatred of the world in one community in 1922.
Fans of Napoleon Dynamite will love this endearing comedy with its visual flair and delicious fairy-tale magic.
A time-travel love story that salutes the spiritual practice of waiting.
What a thrill to hear the songs of Leonard Cohen treated with such reverence and to learn so much about his life and creativity.
A riveting and quirky movie about the aftershocks of 9/11 in the lives of a group of people still in denial a year later.
Superman as a lonely savior who in a moment of desperate need must rely on the help of some friends.
A documentary to make your blood boil -- if you love cars, cherish the environment, and scorn the power and privileges of oil companies.
A smashing success as a glimpse of the fashion world and as a depiction of a young woman's introduction to the ethical choices that form character on the job.
Takes a great idea and runs it into the ground.
A gut-wrenching film that lifts the shroud of secrecy surrounding the treatment of prisoners at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba.
A scary and illuminating documentary made by an American that draws out our empathy for the grieving families of slain civilians in the Iraq war.
movie_title: The Blood of My Brother: A Story of Death in Iraq (2006)

movie_review_blurb: A well-realized dystopian sci-fi drama about addiction and paranoia.
A lyrical and heart-affecting French drama that reveals that we must each encounter death on our own terms.
A strange and oddly touching tale about a man's yearning to reconnect with his first love of 30 years ago.
A graceful exploration of the primal emotions that emerge when five thirtysomething long-time friends gather for a wedding.
A feel-good comedy about a slacker buddy who turns out to go way beyond his obligations as a best man.
A spiritual story that challenges us to deeply listen and to let its mysteries work on our hearts and souls until we discover what part is ours to play.
A documentary about Amma, India's hugging saint, that reveals her large reserves of unconditional love, playfulness, compassion, and service of the poor.
A fascinating French film about two cultures in collision and the sexual drives of middle-age women vacationing in Haiti.
An overstuffed and immensely tedious comedy that sinks early in its voyage.
movie_title: Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest (2006)

movie_review_blurb: A playful documentary about crossword puzzle-heads that is a total delight from start to finish.
Presents diversity and richness of music in contemporary Istanbul.
movie_title: Crossing the Bridge: The Sound of Istanbul (2006)

movie_review_blurb: A zealous coach and an extraordinary African-American high school basketball star making beautiful music together by giving themselves up to the Game.
A satire that sets its sights too high and elicits only a few laughs here and there.
An environmentally conscious Newbery Honor novel has been turned into a disappointing and uninspired movie.
A family film that is only sporadically funny.
A disaster film that goes blub blub in the night.
Overwrought psychodrama revolving around the predictable warps and obsessions of three adult siblings.
Starts out as an engaging character drama but surrenders to gunplay.
A violent and grungy film about revenge.
A bold and imaginative portrait of the life of Jesus of Nazareth and his struggles.
Opens the door for many spiritual seekers to think afresh about Jesus, sexuality, the Sacred Feminine and the great mysteries that cannot be contained in dogmas.
Gore's "traveling global warming show" brims over with insight, idealism, and hope.
Want to take your kids to a movie that equates junk food and fun? If so, then this one's for you.
An epic fantasy that tries to outdo Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon but doesn't touch us emotionally.
movie_title: The Promise (Master of Crimson Armor) (Wu ji) (2005)

movie_review_blurb: Anyone who has ever felt like an outsider or a pariah will identify with the engaging themes of this rousing adventure.
A rousing drama about an egocentric and restless young gymnast's spiritual transformation.
Plenty of money for big businesses in Operation Iraqi Freedom but little moral or financial support for returning troops and their traumas.
A sporadically funny comedy about a crisis in the relationship of a smiley couple who seem to think that life should be an endless run of happy days.
A fine and funny entertainment that also gives us a keen sense of the impermanence of all creative endeavors and the fleeting nature of reality.
Honks its horn for the rewards and satisfactions of community versus the emptiness of selfishness and the culture's focus on winning and fame.
An extraordinary Israeli film that is unlike any other wedding film ever made!
Five African-American women dancers strut their stuff and revel in their camaraderie and fulfilling careers doing what they love best.
A delightfully relaxed and entertaining Thai movie about a country hospital and two doctors who work there.
A bittersweet comedy about aging Baby Boomers and their valiant efforts to find love and their share of happiness in an active adult community in Florida.
A colorful and offbeat documentary about Kenny Shopsin, a cook, entrepreneur, and raconteur in a popular Greenwich Village restaurant.
A World War I aviation film that peddles clichés about the camaraderie of men who fight together.
A very unappealing animated feature about Babe Ruth, baseball, and family values.
Film noir set in Los Angeles in 1947 is way too long, poorly acted, and covered with a haze of cigarette smoke.
The shadow side of imagination is revealed through the adventures of a batty young man who lives in his own little dream world.
One of the best films of the year with its depiction of the dynamics of power in politics and the dangers that ensure when paranoia overtakes a leader and those around him.
A brash and bold coming-of-age movie about a wild band of youth in Astoria, Queens, during the summer of 1986.
movie_title: A Guide to Recognizing Your Saints (2006)

movie_review_blurb: An inspiring look at the Coast Guard's Rescue Swimmers whose motto is "So others may live."
An audacious cinematic triumph by director Stephen Frears animated by an Academy-award caliber performance by Helen Mirren that humanizes Queen Elizabeth in a time of crisis and change.
A well-acted spiritual drama about love, loss, and transformation.
The story of how a self-absorbed Korean film director spreads chaos and disappointment into the lives of two women he seduces and abandons.
A visually stunning and restorative film about the necessity of having fallow time as a prelude to creativity.
A gritty and gutsy examination of how African nations are suffering incredible hardships and poverty under the boots of Western globalization policies.
An elegant and poignant sequel to the 1967 movie Belle de Jour about memory, time, and human yearning.
A fascinating new installment of a documentary series that focuses this time on English middle-agers and their achievements and disappointments in life.
An invitation to give up all the stories you tell yourself about logic, time, and understandable characters and enter the Lynchian world of mysteries where the refreshing password is "don't know."
Stylish and sensitive rendering of the loneliness of six Parisians and their furtive quests for love.
Touches the heart with its wonderful portraits of Spanish women whose nurturing and loving powers are a stay against the powers of violence and death.
A funny, poignant, and jubilant Iranian film about some passionate female soccer fans that ends with a mystical moment of oneness.
One of the most original and nuanced suburban dramas ever to grace the screen; it explores the complexity and intensity of yearning.
An English black comedy about a housekeeper who turns out be quite a miracle-worker in a dysfunctional preacher's family.
A wake-up call for liberals and progressive Christians about the training of evangelical children soldiers in the culture wars.
A turning-point documentary which presents the truth about the war in Iraq in the profound and troubling words of veterans who fought there.
A tense urban drama about two gutsy undercover cops who enjoy their improvised lives of danger and surprises.
A Woody Allen comedy that is both sophomoric and silly.
A teen comedy version of a woman scorned that turns out to be a celebration of a chauvinist who triumphs in the end.
A heartfelt drama set in the Los Angeles Latino community about a nurturing 85-year-old man who takes under his wings two rebels ostracized by their own families.
An exquisitely filmed drama about the collie with a huge heart and a quest that proves her love for her favorite human companion.
A moving mystery of the heart based on a novel by Armistead Maupin about the lengths some people will go to find acceptance and love.
Salutes the courage and lovingkindness of those who reached out in the darkness to help others on September 11.
An unconventional love story about a couple who try to recapture the enchantment of their long-ago relationship and learn they have to let go with equanimity in middle age.
Three generations of women struggle to survive in an inhospitable wilderness in Brazil far from civilization.
A spicy romantic comedy about two emotionally illiterate men who wake up just in time and see the error of their stupid ways.
Two prostitutes in Madrid struggle to survive and keep their dreams of a better life alive.
A true story of a Philadelphia Eagles football fan who digs deep within and discovers a new life for himself beyond his wildest dreams
One of the best films of the year catches the loss and loneliness of two men unwilling to let go of the past and step into a new day.
A heart-affecting Chinese film about an elderly man's journey of love that becomes a path of awakening for him.
movie_title: Riding Alone for Thousands of Miles (2006)

movie_review_blurb: The fascinating story of the heroism of a busy Sunni doctor in Baghdad running for parliament in Iraq's January 30, 2005, election.
An extraordinary documentary about Father Mychal Judge who followed his natural caring impulse into a life of compassionate service of others.
An extraordinary and enthralling documentary about the richness of Tibetan Buddhism and the current threats to its continued existence in its homeland.
movie_title: Journey into Buddhism: Vajra Sky Over Tibet (2006)

movie_review_blurb: Maggie Gyllenhaal in a top-drawer performance as a hopeful ex-con who is trying to turn her life around.
A stylish film noir about the death of TV's Superman that reveals the inevitable downward arc of disappointment resulting from high expectations and belief in the hype of success and fame.
A very funny and touching family drama about the wisdom that often comes not with success but with failure.
A compelling documentary that touches the heart with its account of a tenacious street artist's transformation thanks to the hospitality of a caring and compassionate woman.
A substantive film about an idealistic Danish aid worker who is forced to stretch his own capacities for love and compassion, directing them in new channels that surprise and challenge him.
A compelling drama about the 1994 genocide in Rwanda and the moral heroism of a compassionate priest.
A tour de force comedy/drama about the positive effects of cross-cultural understanding and spiritual openness.
A compelling espionage thriller that reveals the untold dangers and depths of role-playing and raw sexuality.
A screen adaptation of a 17th-century pastoral novel in which French director Eric Rohmer explores two of his favorite subjects: fidelity and jealousy.
A riveting and realistic Romanian film about an abortion and a young woman who proves that friendship is the crown of life.
A classic in the literature of illness brought to the screen with all its creative juices intact, the film salutes the firepower of imagination as a life-giver and a life-sustainer.
movie_title: The Diving Bell and the Butterfly (2007)

movie_review_blurb: A compelling and poignant Koran film about a besieged widow's journey into the far country of forgiveness.
A fascinating documentary about abstract art, child prodigies, play and media exploitation.
An important and edifying documentary that can convince many to open their hearts and their minds to support gay and lesbian equality.
movie_title: For the Bible Tells Me So (2007)

movie_review_blurb: A scary, poignant, and unforgettable film that elicits our outrage and compassion as it puts faces and feelings on the victims of the international trade in sex slaves.
A phantasmagoric trip that explores Bob Dylan as a mystery man and a shape-shifter par excellence
A young man on a mission of love follows the yearning of his heart and savors the many delights of people watching in the city.
movie_title: En la Ciudad de Sylvia (In the City of Sylvia) (2007)

movie_review_blurb: A quirky and bloody meditation on the rising tide of violence in America by the Coen brothers.
A breezy film set in Paris about a busy single parent and her playful seven-year-old son in which a red balloon signals beauty and joy.
movie_title: Le Voyage du Ballon Rouge (The Flight of the Red Balloon) (2007)

movie_review_blurb: Explores with creative and comic energy the difficulties of the sibling bond and the mixed feelings we often have for those who share our history.
There are a few hilarious scenes but no character we care about, making this remake inferior to Elaine May's 1972 film.
A flat, boring, and simple-minded fantasy flick about the battle between the dark forces and the forces of light and goodness.
movie_title: The Seeker: The Dark Is Rising (2007)

movie_review_blurb: The adventures of a handsome libertine, his sexy Spanish mistress, and the beautiful young woman he is engaged to marry.
movie_title: Une Vieille Maîtresse (The Last Mistress) (An Old Mistress) (2007)

movie_review_blurb: A troubling and sad portrait of a teenager who refuses to take moral responsibility for his actions.
A poignant and powerful thriller about corporate malfeasance that reveals what it is like to face life-shattering moments.

A portrait of a modern-day saint, a courageous Spanish Catholic priest in the Dominican Republic with a ministry of compassion to poor, enslaved Haitian immigrants. One of the best documentaries of the year.
A spunky spiritual adventure story about three American brothers traveling through India and trying to connect with each other and come to terms with the past and death.
A tepid and stilted Chinese soap opera about two sisters and their uneasy relationship.
movie_title: The Beauty Remains (Mei ren yi jiu) (2007)

movie_review_blurb: A fascinating portrait of 30 years in a turbulent relationship between a domineering Chinese father and his stubborn son.

Challenges us to change our consciousness and transform our lives by living lightly on the Earth in harmony with nature; offering a road map to a sustainable future, this is one of the most important documentaries of the year.
This first co-production between the United States and India starts badly and never recovers.
The screenplay writers have created a confused mess that travels down far too many different thematic paths.
A lonely dolphin serves as a mediator in the reconciliation of a father and daughter who don't know how to connect with each other.
A psychologically rich documentary about the spiritual practice of generosity and the difficulty we all have in letting go of rigid ideas and habit energies which have dominated our lives.
movie_title: The Monastery: Mr. Vig and the Nun (2006)

movie_review_blurb: A fanciful and enganging metaphysical mystery about a writer, two beauties, love and the challenges of the creative process.
movie_title: The Inner Life of Martin Frost (2007)

movie_review_blurb: A parabolic film about the early life of the Tibetan Buddhist saint Milarepa that works as a teaching story about the futility and emptiness of violence and revenge.
A heartfelt documentary about the charismatic and idealist leader of Chile who sought to bring a fair and free world to his people.
A stirring documentary about the experiences of the ten astronauts from every single Apollo mission that flew to the Moon.
movie_title: In the Shadow of the Moon (2007)

movie_review_blurb: After watching this riveting film, you will have more compassion than ever for the soldiers who have served and are serving in Iraq at great danger to their bodies, minds, and souls. One of the best films of 2007.
An engrossing Australian film about four orphans whose deep bonds of friendship are tested during a summer vacation in paradise.
A positively enchanting romantic drama adapted from a novel by Charles Baxter that speaks volumes about love and challenges us all to grow a bigger heart.

A phantasmagoric trip through the 1960s with the melodic music of the Beatles and a strident salute to love, liberation, and creative expression that will take your breath away if you just go with the flow.
A romantic comedy about a kooky couple that sinks in a whirlpool of therapeutic clichés.
An engaging love story set in Tel Aviv squanders its good vibes with a totally unbelievable violent finale.
A vacuous and boring tale about an outrageous quest for lost treasure.
A comedy with unappealing characters and an ending that just doesn't make any sense given what has preceded it.
A delightful and totally refreshing drama about a book club who become a community of supportive friends as they weather the changes and challenges in their lives.
A scary and powerful fictional story based on real events that probes the violence behind the so-called collateral damage in the Iraq war.

A thoughtful and insightful Italian documentary that retraces writer Primo Levi's 1945 trip from Poland to Italy after he was liberated from Auschwitz; it contains a fascinating glimpse of post-communist Europe.
A tense crime thriller directed by Sidney Lumet that explores the dark side of sibling rivalry.
movie_title: Before the Devil Knows You're Dead (2007)

movie_review_blurb: An animated autobiographical masterpiece about one Iranian woman's intense quest for the holy grail of freedom - one of the most imaginative and important films of the year.
A tender and touching movie about a father who learns how to nurture his daughters while in the midst of grief.
A literary drama about the incredible damage caused by lying and the power of the imagination to amend reality.
A morally charged drama about the nasty games played by the rich and the powerful in Washington, D.C.
We hope that youth will take to heart this movie which calls us to be wary of all authoritarian institutions that stifle the soul and the spiritual search for truth.
An unrelentingly bleak and depressing drama about an Iraqi war veteran who is unable to deal with his rage.
An ambitious spiritual drama based on a novella by Mircea Eliade, this unwieldy movie fails as a compelling human drama and fills the screen instead with mind-numbingly dull intellectual matters.
One of the best films of the year about the love, kindness, and hospitality of a Christian community for a lost and lonely soul.
A memorable and moving drama about the pain of lost friendship, the yearning for forgiveness, and the freedom that comes from making amends.
One of the brightest and funniest comedies of the year with a delicious performance by Ellen Page as a precocious and big-hearted teenager on a mission of love.
An engrossing documentary on the atrocities committed in Nanking by Japanese soldiers and the courageous heroism of some expats in 1937.
A drama about the friendship between an Orthodox Jewish woman and a Muslim woman with two radiant performances and an important message about respecting religious diversity
A deeply spiritual comedy about the bridge-making capacities of hospitality and the way music serves as universal language that draws people together.
The engrossing true-life drama of an idealistic young man who yearns to live alone in the Alaskan wilderness and to reap the soulful benefits of solitude in the spirit of Thoreau.
An inspiring and well-acted film about an extraordinary African-American debating team in the 1930s with the talent and determination to excel.
A rambunctious and funny musical spoof of musical biopics starring John C. Reilly.
movie_title: Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story (2007)

movie_review_blurb: A snappy political satire about a Texas Congressman and his efforts to win the Cold War by defeating the Russians in Afghanistan in the 1980s.
An action adventure flick that careens from one preposterous plot development to another.
Doesn't add anything fresh or special or memorable to our understanding of the grief process.
A scary sci-fi story set in Manhattan in 2012 where a lone surviving scientist struggles to find a cure for the virus that has destroyed most of the human race.
A small and intimate drama about a seventy-year old New York novelist and his battle against time. physical vulnerability, and being creatively blocked.
An engrossing family drama about old age, nursing homes, dementia, death and siblings trying to forge a new bond with each other.
Sheridan's magical movie blooms at the crossroads of music, melodrama, and love; leaving the theatre, you'll find yourself happily immersed in the sounds of the streets.
The difficulties of coming-of-age in an Irish-American family with a violent older brother and a self-destructive father.
An unusual film set in Mongolia which contrasts the spiritual vitalities of shamanism with the dehumanizing rigors of industrial capitalism.
An absorbing and gritty drama that compels us to think seriously about the complicated moral dimensions of what serves the best interests of children in America.
An eye-opening documentary that reveals the diversity and zeal of the resistance movement in Iraq to the U.S. occupation of their homeland.
Explores the dark side of the so-called war on terrorism where human rights are ignored by the CIA and spit upon by Islamic terrorists.
A deeply emotional film that gives us a deeper respect for those trying to recover from the loss of a loved one or enslavement to an addiction.
movie_title: Things We Lost in the Fire (2007)

movie_review_blurb: A smart and sassy romantic comedy about two people who are surprised by love and forced to navigate its tricky waters in a large extended family setting.
An inspirational drama about a loving and compassionate man who gives a troubled and lonely woman a new lease on life with a selfless act of kindness.

An inspiring documentary about former President Jimmy Carter's book tour for 'Palestine: Peace Not Apartheid' where he puts on display his political wisdom, his Christian faith-based service, and his emotional literacy.
A hopeful and helpful movie that depicts the friendship between a Jew and an Arab that outlasts the winds of war and the culture of revenge and racial hatred surrounding them.
A miserable mess of a stream-of-consciousness movie.
Adds nothing new or fresh to our understanding of how individuals cope with the sudden and tragic death of a loved one.
A comedy masterwork that touches the heart with its portrait of the survival tactics of an abandoned orphan and the loving ministrations of a widowed science fiction writer who adopts him.
An uplifting documentary about the healing powers of music, song, and dance on a group of traumatized Ugandan youth who participate in a National Music Competition.
An inspiring documentary about six very different courageous and creative activists who are doing what they can to help the suffering people of Darfur.
An uninvolving and depressing serving of talk about the inadequacy of politicians, the power of the media, senseless deaths overseas, and the apathy of youth.
A bulked-up and dumbed-down 3-D screen version of the Old English epic that is aimed at the shiver-me and scare-me crowd.
This highly melodramatic screen version of the heralded 1985 novel by Gabriel Garcia Marquez is a major disappointment.
movie_title: Love in the Time of Cholera (2007)

movie_review_blurb: A playful and enlightening documentary featuring Zen master and accomplished cook Edward Espe Brown with nourishing tips on food and paying attention.
A sequel in which the Virgin Queen struggles to hold on to power in a time of great religious violence and personal challenges.
A scary documentary about the violence occurring in Sao Paulo, Brazil, where the chasm between the super-rich and the poor is growing more obscene day by day.
A raunchy teen comedy flick about parties and having sex that really wants to say something about male friendship.
A feisty single parent's startling plan to pull herself out of poverty by moving to another city.
A stirring morality play about the importance of choices in our lives, especially in regard to love, friendship, power, and forgiveness.
A delightful and varied glimpse of men and women grappling with love, meaning, and loss in various neighborhoods of Paris.
An engaging romantic drama about an emotionally stunted teacher who falls in love and attempts to open his heart to the challenges of an intimate relationship.
A wonderful Belgian slapstick comedy about leaving home and finding the perfect iceberg to chill out on.
A riveting study of paranoia and the wild and destructive behavior that it can spawn.
A wild and wacky movie about international politics, terrorism, and the antics of an American trickster.
An idiosyncratic and larky movie that celebrates the virtue of hospitality as a grace that lubricates relationships and facilitates community.
Account of a legal campaign launched by women to expose the brutality of domestic violence and male chauvinism.
An occasion to meditate upon the frightfulness of heroin addiction and why many youth opt for the euphoria of white powder rather than the promises of the American dream.
Three cheers for Shrek who may have bad b.o. but whose heart is in the right place!
A tightly structured family drama that accurately portrays the domestic wars that can drive family members apart.
A mega-laugh comedy about the messiness of change with lovable characters whose humor and flawed humanity make them very appealing.
A bloated, repetitive sea saga that is the cinematic equivalent of pigging out at a fast food franchise.
movie_title: Pirates of the Caribbean: At Worlds End (2007)

movie_review_blurb: An intriguing drama about a quirky leggy blonde angel who comes to Paris on a mission of mercy to show a self-destructive and petty man his worth.
A Japanese film that draws out our respect and compassion for a man whose life is turned upside down by the early onset of Alzheimer's.
A fifteen-year old girl becomes a fierce little soccer warrior thanks to some encouraging words from her brother and father.
Preposterous characters surround a serial killer in a strained and unbelievable story.
An Aboriginal adventure story about forbidden love, sorcery, fear of strangers, and justice that proves that a tale well told is good medicine for all.
A family drama that flies all over the place and does not do justice to the serious ethical issues it raises.
A charming and endearing Irish film about two down-and-out individuals who collaborate on a musical project that deeply enriches them both in surprising ways.
A suspense thriller that switches gears far too many times mixing humor and horror.
An unfunny French comedy with unappealing characters.
A parabolic film about one selfish young man's spiritual transformation.
An engaging World War II drama set in Holland and focused on the resiliency of a Jewish woman struggling to stay alive in terrible times.
A fast-moving and highly dramatic depiction of Clifford Irving's media hoax of 1971 as a sign of the moral rot at the heart of American culture.
A clever satire on the dynamics of prime-time television in America with its sleazy programs and its slavery to ratings and ad dollars.
The only good thing about this supernatural thriller is that the atheist finally comes to see that most of the evil in the world is caused not by Satan but by human fear and hatred.
A touching comedy about a lonely young woman who follows her bliss and finds all she needs in the companionship of animals.
A well-realized drama about Tibetans living in exile in India and their quest to find meaning.
An engrossing documentary about a compassionate doctor trying to make a difference in Afghanistan which has the second highest maternal and infant mortality rates in the world.
A thoroughly original gritty urban drama set in Glasgow that covers surveillance, urban loneliness, grief, and empathy.
A thoroughly thought-provoking thriller with fascinating characters and riveting performances by Ryan Gosling and Anthony Hopkins.
A subtle, poignant, and superbly acted drama about a long marriage that is tested externally by disease and internally by the chords of attachment.
Does what a great romantic comedy should do: steal your heart and send you on your way rejoicing. One of the best films of the year.
An uplifting and heartening Uruguayan film about a poor and kind boy whose life is transformed during the 40 days of carnival.
A scary and gripping drama that follows an earnest young suicide bomber on her mission to Times Square.
A psychologically rich drama that reveals how a sad and lonely Englishman is transformed by his ability to ride the coincidences which manifest in his life.
A sobering and serious Australian movie that touches the deep places in us that are haunted and colored by love, loss, community, and grief.
A scruffy drama about four diggers on Long Island in 1976 who are dragged kicking and screaming into changing their lives.
Barely flickers as a far-fetched urban tale of chameleon-like characters.
Shows very little respect for women and makes a youthful male soft-core porn writer into a supposed seer dispensing wisdom.
An astonishing performance by Marion Cotillard as the legendary French chanteuse Edith Piaf whose life was a rollercoaster ride of exhilarating highs and incredibly depressing lows.
A pleasant and entertaining animated film that salutes those who believe that winning isn't all it's cracked up to be.
A fast-paced lark of a movie that makes it clear that in this cruel and crafty world, friends have to stick together.
An emotionally powerful drama about the dirty business of capital punishment.
A Mexican drama set in Acapulco that revolves around flimsily drawn characters who fail to elicit our empathy.
Starts out as a revealing drama about the Inquisition in Spain in 1792 but spins out of control trying to convey the big picture of turmoil in the country 15 years later.
Three cheers for this jubilant, funny, and phantasmagorical musical!
A funny, witty, bright, and well-acted costume drama about a fictional turning point in the life of the famous French playwright Moliere.
A romantic comedy about a perfectionistic chef who discovers a new life for herself once she lets go of the illusion of controlling her days with a rigorous set of rules and habits.
A documentary about a watershed trial in 1973 of some anti-war activists from the Catholic Left who took a stand on the basis of conscience.
An extraordinary documentary that heightens our connection with the lives and destinies of an Arctic polar bear and a walrus.
A riveting English film about a fatherless 12-year-old English kid who joins a band of skinheads and is initiated into a world that rocks his being.
One of the most searing and emotionally shattering documentaries ever made about the indifference of the world to genocide.
An extraordinary drama about childhood and imagination as a passport out of dread and into mystery.
A totally enchanting costume drama about Jane Austen's yearning for love and a place in the literary world dominated by men.
An extraordinary French drama about the reactions of a conservative nine-year old girl to the radical politics and changes brought into her life by her parents.
movie_title: Blame It on Fidel (La Faute a Fidel) (2006)

movie_review_blurb: A spiritual masterpiece on gratitude, transformation and surrender to God by the gifted Iranian filmmaker Majid Majidi. Rumi would love it!
A children's movie about a superhero beagle that recycles material and themes we've seen far too often in Hollywood movies.
The stew of salsa music is delicious but the drama of drug addiction and a tempestuous marriage are nothing more than stale leftovers from many other biopictures.
A realistic depiction of the emotional quicksand of depression and its effects on everyone around it.
A very funny romantic tale that creatively plays around with the cultural clashes between Americans and French men and women.
A pleasant adult fairy tale about a young man who goes on a quest and returns home a different person transformed by what he has seen and experienced.
One of the year's most endearing coming-of-age stories.
A mesmerizing film by South Korean director Kim Ki-Duk about cosmetic surgery and the yearning of those who put their faith in external physical changes to their bodies.
The story of a single-minded young man whose dream of making it on the international stage of soccer comes true thanks to the enthusiasm of others.
movie_title: Goal! The Dream Begins (Goal!: The Impossible Dream) (2005)

movie_review_blurb: Explores the many levels of a friendship between a button-down African-American radio program director and a tell-it-like-it-is deejay who connects with the black community in Washington D.C
A cinematic tribute to a genuine working-class hero whose courage and zeal for justice fueled the Solidarity Movement in Poland.
A fearless teenage amateur detective models courtesy, passion, and creativity in her sleuthing activities.
An extraordinary documentary that helps us understand the full sweep and implications of the "Made in China" label.
A wacky and endearing love story set in New Zealand that brings to mind the oddball charm of Napoleon Dynamite.
An entertaining and edifying documentary about the music and lives of a group of gypsy performers from four countries on an international concert tour.
movie_title: When the Road Bends: Tales of a Gypsy Caravan (2007)

movie_review_blurb: A tender, lyrical, and graceful screen adaptation of D. H. Lawrence's controversial novel about the sexual awakening of one woman.

Typical of director Michael Winterbottom's integrity, a fast-paced and compassionate look at all the complicated forces surrounding the attempt to rescue kidnapped reporter Danny Pearl in Pakistan in 2002
A psychologically rich drama that presents an illuminating anatomy of the anguish of loneliness and the way it often gives a desperate edge to our search for love.
A blistering and convincing documentary designed to spur reform for a new system of universal health care.
An underwhelming psychological thriller and ghost story.
Evan's ark offers refuge for the lions, tigers, elephants, and other animals from distant habitats, but they, like us, would have been better off just staying home.
An outstanding family film about a teenage girl in New Zealand whose openness to others and yearning for justice is inspirational.
A rounded and robust overview of Iranian cinema and its shifting relationship to the political and religious tides in that country's history and culture.

A psychologically rich drama dealing with the matters of the heart we must face as we swing from the ardor of first love to the peace of our last breath: yearning, memory, mistakes, regret, and the healing power of friendship.
A daring documentary about two violent young Haitian gang leaders and their lives in a slum that is a truly a hell on earth.
A rousing British farce filled with many antic moments and huge embarrassments.
An enchanting Swiss movie about a musical prodigy and his loving grandfather who nurtures his dream and gives him the space to be himself.
A slam-bang sci-fi action drama with exploding cars, razzle-dazzle battle sequences, a bling-wearing dog, robots with heart, and a secret agent with silly underwear.
An Australian family drama that depicts how difficult people can help us refine and polish our finer qualities.

A rousing adventure that includes Harry Potter's first kiss, his encounter with the odiousness of order, his feelings of loneliness in the face of an indifferent world, and his slow realization of the support of his friends.
movie_title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (2007)

movie_review_blurb: A breezy and whimsical French film about friendship.
A 30-year-old French writer's struggles with the challenges of work and love in his fast-paced and fragmented urban life.
A dark film filled with improbable stunts and unbelievable plot developments that uses women as props and objects just to keep the mayhem and the momentum going full tilt.
A comedy about a young man's wild quest to become the greatest artist in the 21st century.
A mesmerizing Australian movie about one lonely sixteen-year-old girl's yearning for intimacy.
Explores the experiences of a devout Muslim and his secular adolescent son as they drive through seven countries on the pilgrimage to Mecca.
A rip-roaring documentary that will take you to places you have never been before and introduce you to some extraordinary quadriplegics.
A shocking and soul-shaking Austrian documentary about the dire effects of globalization upon the poor citizens of Tanzania.
A bold and compelling film that explores the passionate connection between a fiery idealist and his sixteen-year old daughter.
movie_title: The Ballad of Jack and Rose (2005)

movie_review_blurb: Presents the ordeal suffered by a Muslim family in Palestine when their home is occupied by enemy Israeli soldiers.
A well-done Hungarian black comedy set in Budapest's underground subway system.
An engrossing Italian psychodrama about a driven man's obsession with a warped vision of beauty and a woman's sad subservience to his efforts to make her over.
An exquisitely filmed and acted story about the way beauty serves as a healing force in the lives of an adolescent girl and a grieving mother.
An innovative romantic coming-of-age tale set in a tough ghetto area outside Paris populated mainly by Muslim kids from North Africa.
An Iranian film about the midlife crisis of a self-absorbed man who can't accept or understand why his wife wants to divorce him.
A lively and entertaining youth drama about the coming of change in a repressive small town.
A warm and richly rendered black-and-white documentary about three elderly Jewish masters of Klezmer music.
Powerful depiction of the psychological terror that grips a California community after New York and other cities in the East are destroyed by nuclear bombs.
A light-hearted romantic comedy about a young couple trying to sort out their priorities about love. work and sports.
An engrossing film about the renewal that comes to a family that has been mourning a loved one for a long time.
The plot flies in too many directions, and the derring-do stunts are ho-hum.
Two out of these three short films misfire.
A comedy that really works thanks to the appealing performance by Queen Latifah as an entrepreneur determined to fulfill her dream.
Celebrates the kindness of strangers and the elixir of love in a world grown cold due to selfishness, violence, and indifference.
An emotionally involving drama set in Angola about the valiant and unheralded heroism of poor people struggling to survive after a thirty year civil war.
Ice Princess is carried by the subtle and shining performance of Michelle Trachtenberg.
Swimming Upstream will resonate mightily with those who have struggled through a painful childhood with a difficult parent.
A funny film that pokes fun at the specialists in mind, body and soul who peddle wisdom about sex in today's excessive self-improvement marketplace.
An embarrassingly bad comedy.
Here is an erotic thriller that instead of sizzling, fizzles.
A powerful, prophetic, and utterly mesmerizing Iranian film set in 2003 Iraq about the fallout from both dictators and liberators on the torn lives of refugee children.
Hitch doesn't impress with its sophomoric observations on sexual politics.
Three enchanting cine-essays by the French director Agnes Varda triggered by her love of photography.
Bruno Ganz as Hitler gives a tour de force performance that delineates the darkest dimensions of a bunker mentality.
An unusual Brazilian drama that shows it's never too late to move beyond the barriers of class, fear, and habit for the prize of love.
movie_title: The Other Side of the Street (2004)

movie_review_blurb: An extraordinary documentary about the friendship between two activist elders in a Los Angeles retirement community for political progressives.
Here is the most endearing, charming, creative and spiritually uplifting movie since Amelia set our hearts swooning.
Beautifully and convincingly conveys the baffling ways in which love and place can work their wonders upon us and bring about transformation in their wake.
A delightful drama about some feisty souls involved in an Irish musical competition and their close encounters with the difficult spiritual art of letting go.
movie_title: The Boys and Girl from County Clare (2004)

movie_review_blurb: Offers a rounded and revealing story of the radical experiment in restorative justice in South Africa following the downfall of apartheid.
A real chore to sit through.
An engrossing and well-acted psychodrama about the toxic side-effects of anger, a potent and volatile emotion.
A frolicsome and endlessly creative animated feature.
Melinda and Melinda revolves around neurotic and selfish characters who are unappealing in every way.
Bruce Willis struggles valiantly to have us empathize with his character's effort to redeem himself in his own eyes, but he fails and can only gush tears.
A delightful French film about the different shades of love and lust as experienced by a married couple and the husband's two best friends.
With great dramatic flair, this fine film depicts how a larger-than-life young man who is both abrasive and fesity has a transforming effect on a sheltered friend.
An engrossing documentary that vividly presents the variety and vitality of Hindu devotion.
movie_title: Short Cut to Nirvana: Kumbh Mela (2004)

movie_review_blurb: An engrossing parable about power, greed, arrogance, and ethical malfeasance on a grand scale.
movie_title: Enron: The Smartest Guys in the Room (2005)

movie_review_blurb: One of the best films of the year with its rousing treatment of caretaking, aging, anti-war sentiments, and the bounties of the heart.
An engrossing five-part anatomy of a marriage gone bad, directed by Francois Ozon.
A wearisome hybrid of action drama and romantic comedy.
Extraordinary documentary on two Buddhist rituals that bring out thousands to meditate and to express their devotion.
Five New York City denizens yearning for love who reveal they have not learned the abc's of emotional literacy.
A refreshingly original and touching film about the incredible loneliness of isolated individuals in this digital age of so-called connectedness.
movie_title: Me and You and Everyone We Know (2005)

movie_review_blurb: A drama revolving around Christian faith and rebellion in an authoritarian Macedonian orphanage after World War II.
Exotic and erotic English film about two young girls who are carried away by their yearning to lose themselves in something transcendent.
Offers a visually creative and multidimensional exploration of the alienation and ennui of provincial workers in a theme park outside Beijing.
Dopey and predictable romantic comedy.
An exploration of sexuality by a stunningly attractive and alluring sixteen year and a shy Arab boy who is fascinated and frightened by her playful expressiveness
An extraordinary French documentary on the lives and habits of Emperor Penguins in Antarctica: it is a wonder to behold!
Delivering much more than a sci-fi extravaganza for the age of terrorism, Spielberg keeps us rooting for a family facing danger from without and distress from within.
A tender and poignant cross-cultural tale of a young man's search for his father with a finale filled with grace and love and humility.
An extraordinary documentary about the transformations brought about in prisoners after they practiced meditation in India's Tihar Prison.
A thought-provoking drama about money, power and the heated-up war against the winning class.
Explores the melding of rock music and the playfulness of sex.
A light-hearted, playful love story set in China with a tribute to the soul-stirring powers of French literature.
movie_title: Balzac and the Little Chinese Seamstress (2005)

movie_review_blurb: An enticing and erotic love story that takes us into fresh territory in its exploration of the divisions that separate people from each other.
An odd movie that wears its idiosyncrasies poorly.
Bring back Jack Black and forget this.
A French romantic comedy that goes nowhere.
An old-fashioned tale about the real life struggle of a small Indiana community to come alive again.
An inane flick about two immature lovers.
Explores the primal emotions of sibling rivalry and the toxins of violence in those returning home from war zones.
A subversive and boldly creative Korean film about a silent young man who travels light, falls in love, and turns into a liberator.
Features a dapper young Englishman who learns to treasure his towel, to leap at love and never rest on his laurels as a member of the human race.
movie_title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy (2005)

movie_review_blurb: A crash course in unmasking the racial and class divisions in American society that make every stranger into a potential enemy.
Depicts one young French woman's escape into a world of wild love, danger, freedom, and adventure.
Scores a few points for its positive portrait of Muslims in the time of the Crusades.
Reveals the pain and suffering wrought by sex offenders who prey upon children.
Impresses with its intricate and intimate portrait of kindness and yearning.
An unappealing comedy with a terminal case of bad choices
Lacking in dramatic punch, animated only by mind-numbing action sequences and endless light-saber fights.
movie_title: Star Wars: Episode III - Revenge of the Sith (2005)

movie_review_blurb: Makes the point that we are all one family and the degradation and slavery of one child working in horrible conditions diminishes us all.
A light-hearted Asian-American romantic comedy that sparkles.
A spunky documentary about the frantic efforts to resurrect the moribund sport of bowling.
A sporadically funny fish-out-of-water story with impressive animation.
Wonderful heart-affecting drama about four teenagers bonded together by caring and a pair of jeans.
movie_title: The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants (2005)

movie_review_blurb: One of the best films of the year, it speaks to the heart and models a working-class hero whose riches have nothing to do with money.
Wide-ranging documentary on the mysteries and marvels of the ocean and the creatures that reside there.
One of the best films of the year-it salutes openness and respect for life as antidotes to the use of violence to deal with the uncertainty and insecurity of our times.
A magical story about a lonely girl whose life is transformed by a smiling stray dog who has a spiritual gift for creating community and bringing joy to everyone.
With a less than stirring performance by Robert De Niro, this one will leave seasoned psychodrama fans underwhelmed.
Aliens of the Deep has a few moments of awe but its overall message is utilitarian, using ocean exploration as a stepping stone to outer space adventures.
Primer has no respect for genuine mystery but relishes obfuscation as being really cool.
Infernal Affairs II contains strong performances by Anthony Wong and Eric Tsang along with some edgy music by Chan Kwong-wing.
Infernal Affairs III reveals the desperate lengths men will go to protect their covers and to survive the internal agonies of fear, stress and lack of trust.
movie_title: Infernal Affairs III (Mou gaan dou III: Jung gik mou gaan) (2003)

movie_review_blurb: A triumphant ode to the bravery of a visionary woman who leads a rebellion against the religious practice of female genital mutilation in her African village.
It's not easy to keep your soul alive in a world of abortions, suburban anomie, sexual predators, and wayward Christians willing to kill in the name of the unborn.
Being Julia is buoyed by an ebullient performance by Annette Bening as a middle-aged actress and extrovert who finally discovers the pleasures of solitude.
p.s. is a fresh romantic comedy that shows how we often sabotage ourselves when love arrives effortlessly in our arms and we don't know what to do with this blessing.
In Ingmar Bergman's magisterial last film, we watch family members bare their souls and in their faces we see intimations of the grand emotions which animate us all.
A high tension police drama set in Hong Kong where the operations of both the police and crime syndicates are hobbled by moles within their organizations.
Sideways is a buddy movie that is a delight from start to finish: it offers a round-trip ticket to the rewards of friendship and the follies and frustrations of middle-age.
A hokey, poorly acted, and disappointing remake of the irresistible 1997 Japanese film.
Macunaima is a strange 1969 Brazilian parable about the voracious appetites within us that never seem to be satisfied.
Lightning in a Bottle is an unforgettable concert that celebrates the blues as the music of the heart.
Birth is an engrossing psychological drama that starts out as a tale about reincarnation and morphs into a sobering examination of grief.
I Am David is a fine family film about a twelve-year old boy's escape from a Bulgarian prison camp and his quest to find out his true identity.
A chilly romantic thriller that certainly doesn't make the point suggested by its title.
Alfie lacks the punch and the vitality of the 1966 film starring Michael Caine.
The Incredibles promotes a new moral slogan for our times: The family that fights evil-doers together stays together.
An unfunny black comedy populated by obnoxious characters.
The Holy Girl explores the difficulties adolescents and older men have in dealing with the most powerful energy source in the world -- their own sexuality.
House of Flying Daggers is a bewitching work of art that succeeds as a sense-luscious drama, an amazing martial arts film and a romantic love story that touches the heart.
A valentine by director Pedro Almodovar to the film noir genre and its capacity to depict the strange things people will do to fulfill their forbidden yearnings.
Explores the terrible fallout in the lives of Arab and Muslim immigrants whose human rights were violated by the U.S. Justice Department's zealous anti-terrorism campaign.
The Motorcycle Diaries is an extraordinary drama about the spiritual transformation that turns an earnest young man into a crusader for justice.
A playful metaphysical comedy that embraces the spiritual uplift of our connections with others amidst the muck of separations that characterize our world.
Dear Frankie is a tender and touching family drama set in Glasgow.
Look at Me is a well-written and brilliantly acted French drama about the sharp edges of celebrityhood and criticism in the literary world.
The Last Shot misfires as a comedy.
Shark Tale spends too much story time promoting lying, bragging, fame, and egotism.
Triple Agent is another psychologically rich drama by Eric Rohmer, the French master of morally nuanced films
Tropical Malady is a mesmerizing Thai film about the mysteries of human desire and the power of darkness where dreams and memories merge.
Undertow is an engrossing thriller that updates the enduring tale of Cain and Abel and also deals with the struggle of two boys to stay alive after their world falls apart.
Our Music presents Jean-Luc Godard's audacious meditation on war, violence, terrorism, victims and the truth that lies in the play of opposites.
In the Battlefields is a bewitching Lebanese film about the dire fallout from a dysfunctional family on the soul of a twelve-year old girl.
A gritty and harrowing Israeli film about the plight of women who are still treated as second-class citizens in a man's world.
An unusual documentary about a young man who has been a good steward of his childhood suffering and pain, creating out of it something that may prove to be helpful to others.
Rivers and Tides: Andy Goldsworthy Working with Time is an extraordinarily spiritually literate documentary about one of the world's greatest nature artists.
movie_title: Rivers and Tides: Andy Goldsworthy Working With Time (2002)

movie_review_blurb: Kings and Queen is a fascinating French film filled with keen observations on sexual politics, psychology, and family roles.
Friday Night Lights is a razzle-dazzle movie about a Texas town and what their win-at-all costs ethic does to the young men on the high-school football team.
Good performances ground this heart-affecting story about four generations of a dysfunctional family who go on a journey of transformation together.
Vera Drake delivers what is rarely seen in contemporary films: a deft and sympathetic depiction of a good person whose compassion and kindness are the real thing.
Ray boasts a great smorgasbord of music and a fine performance by Jamie Foxx but is hobbled by a mediocre screenplay and its long playing time.
A marvelous screen adaptation of the Chris Van Allsburg Christmas classic about one of the great enduring mysteries of the universe -- Santa Claus.
Finding Neverland, one of the best films of the year, is a convincing and tender depiction of the ties between imagination, play, and creativity.
Kinsey contains a treasure trove of thought-provoking material on love, sex, science, ethics, and the crowning touch of creation: diversity.
Lemony Snicket's A Series of Unfortunate Events is a weird and sometimes wonderful film about three creative kids who have what it takes to overcome adversities.
movie_title: Lemony Snicket's A Series of Unfortunate Events (2004)

movie_review_blurb: A mixed bag as a comedy, with some genuine moments of emotional power but far too many awkward and irritating scenes.
This adventure drama about a group trying to survive in the Gobi desert is filled with nothing but hot air.
Many of the songs still enchant even though the film is a disappointment.
Hoffman and Streisand provide some laughs in this sequel to Meet the Parents but the screenplay lacks comic zest.
Boasts a sterling performance by Lynn Collins as an enchanting Portia who makes the most of her beauty and her brains.
movie_title: William Shakespeare's The Merchant of Venice (2004)

movie_review_blurb: A delightful patchwork quilt musical blending elements of Bollywood and Jane Austen.
Contains a spectacular performance by Sean Penn as a powerless and alienated young man whose rage becomes a reality when his dreams are dashed one by one.
A totally engaging film about how two men -- a middle-aged advertising sales manager and a young Turk -- deal with the changes that end up transforming their lives.
An inspirational film about a high school coach who has the gall to suggest that athletes must make their mark in the classroom as well as on the basketball court.
Les Choristes is a heart-warming French film about a kind and gifted music teacher who makes a difference in the lives of his students in a boy's reformatory.
A family film that tries to duplicate the moral uplift of "Babe" and fails miserably with its emphasis upon competition and winning.
Elektra is a mediocre action drama about a reluctant assassin who discovers her nurturing side.
A ho-hum police action drama that did not merit a remake.
Machuca is a powerful coming-of-age story set in Chile that also succeeds as a riveting parable about the virulence of class warfare.
An extraordinary Buddhist road movie about the dangers and unhappiness that comes in our attempts to deny the present moment for dreamlands of our own making.
Nobody Knows is an absorbing drama about what can happen when the sacred trust of looking out for children is violated by families and communities.
She's One of Us is an eerie French film that deals with formidable emotions that less adventuresome directors have found too hot to handle.
Lost Embrace is an engaging Argentine film about a long awaited father-son reunion and the meaning it has for a confused young man.
Beyond the Sea is an energetic biopicture on the life and career of the cocky and irrepressible singer Bobby Darin.
A couple's new marriage is tested on a visit to the groom's family in North Carolina where traditional values hold sway.
A hard-hitting drama about the sharp edges of grief and the need for families to nurture openness and love in the midst of tragedies that test their mettle.
The Keys to the House is a compelling Italian drama about a father-son reunion and the bravery needed to open one's heart to another.
La Petite Lili is an accomplished and elegant French film about love, moviemaking, and the urge to creatively process one's experiences.
Noel delivers two astonishing scenes of love and forgiveness that will take your breath away and are perfectly in tune with the miraculous nature of Christmas.
A romantic film to take to heart with its incisive portrait of a determined young woman's unswerving love.
A ho-hum heist flick.
A fascinating French film set in Japan about power in the workplace and the yearning that fuels a cross-cultural experience.
Michael Moore playfully attacks corruption in politics, greed in corporate hallways, and absurdities in American culture.
Closer is a scorching examination of the shadow side of love and the use of language as a weapon of mass destruction in intimate relationships.
Conspiracy of Silence is a thoughtful drama about some of the formidable challenges faced by reform-minded Catholics who dare to question the tradition of celibacy.
Born into Brothels is an extraordinary documentary about a photographer who draws out the wonder and creativity of some poor kids in Calcutta.
It's a lark to watch this top-drawer cast strutting their stuff in such a playful manner.
An emotionally powerful drama about a woman boxer, a crusty old trainer, and their journey of the heart-one of the year's best
The Sea Inside is one of the best films of the year with a bravura performance by Javier Bardem that is both tender and poignant.
movie_title: The Sea Inside (Mar Adentro) (The Sea Within) (2004)

movie_review_blurb: The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou is another playful tribute by Wes Anderson to a wacky individualist.
movie_title: The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou (2004)

movie_review_blurb: Alexander goes on far too long, and Colin Farrell as the military leader just doesn't live up to the high praise given him in the opening scenes.
This holiday comedy depicts suburbia as a place where all true individualists are treated with a nastiness not in tune with the Christmas spirit.
An Italian masterpiece that elegantly and effortlessly depicts the natural rhythms of life in a rural community in the nineteenth century.
movie_title: The Tree of Wooden Clogs (L'albero degli Zoccoli) (1979)

movie_review_blurb: Best film of the year: an ethically rich story of a heroic African who responds to the deep dimensions of violence in a chaotic world by widening the circle of his compassion.
A Love Song For Bobby Long is a heart-affecting drama about an improvised family fashioned with love, care, and creativity by writer and director Shainee Gabel.
movie_title: A Love Song for Bobby Long (2004)

movie_review_blurb: The Woodsman is one of the best films of the year with its aim of testing the limits of our empathy and compassion.
Charts three decades in the life of Howard Hughes, a forerunner of today's successful businessmen who love power, money, and the chance to do whatever they want.
A delightful comedy about two dying men who travel the world to discover the joy in their lives.
Starts out as an interesting sci-fi thriller about cloning but then turns and takes a downhill course as just another action drama with crashes and explosions galore.
A biodrama about Howard Stern, who speaks for the nine-year old boy in all of us.
A searing expose of the greed and systemic poor treatment of its workers by the largest corporation in the world.
movie_title: Wal-Mart: The High Cost of Low Price (2005)

movie_review_blurb: An inspiring documentary about a charismatic and determined young man who almost single-handedly has changed the way the disabled are treated in Ghana, Africa.
Explores the friendship between a hit man and a suburban businessman that strains belief and leads to a totally improbable finale.
Features an endearing Native American heroine whose playful spirit and yearning for love takes her on a journey far beyond her wildest imaginings.
A sensational performance by Naomi Watts as the beauty who makes even a truly fierce beast beautiful just by loving him.
A romantic comedy that only elicits a few sporadic chuckles; we like Lasse Hallstrom's dramas much better.
Garish, irritating, and totally unfunny.
A romantic comedy that misfires thanks to a storyline that is far too complicated.
A spunky and endearing collection of documentaries by Ross McElwee, a filmmaker with a keen sense of humor and a love of storytelling.
You cannot make a convincing case against terrorism by showing one graphic scene after another of cold-blooded murder.
A powerful drama about a Hungarian boy's coming-of-age in concentration camps during World War II.
One of the best films ever made about the courage and compassion that is at the heart of the Christian path of nonviolence.
A scrappy and fast-paced sports flick set in 1966 that also deals with heart and racism.
An appealing morality play in which Queen Latifah demonstrates a warm embrace of life with humor and humanity.
A delightful romantic comedy about two lovable eccentrics who enjoy playing together.
movie_title: When the Sea Rises (Quand la Mer Monte...) (2006)

movie_review_blurb: An unconventional comedy about a whiny American comedian who sets out to prove that humor can be a good tool for diplomacy.
movie_title: Looking for Comedy in the Muslim World (2006)

movie_review_blurb: A hard-hitting and enlightening documentary designed to arouse citizen activism against any more costly and unnecessary wars.
An engrossing, spiritually sensitive and creative film about Judaism, faith and sexuality.
Hard to believe that someone as seasoned and creative as Woody Allen would have to resort to the cliche -- a gun -- to dramatically solve the predicament of his antihero.
An edifying look at the lives and spiritual practices of twenty Hindu holy men in India who meditate, serve others and take on austerities as part of their path.
A visually impressive adaptation of C. S. Lewis's classic tale, which unfortunately slights the forgiveness theme in favor of a big battle scene led by a not-very-Christlike Aslan the lion.
movie_title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, The Witch and The Wardrobe (2005)

movie_review_blurb: An excruciatingly boring morality tale with poorly developed characters and a big spiritual finale that sputters.
movie_title: The Three Burials of Melquiades Estrada (2006)

movie_review_blurb: A funny and emotionally resonant family drama about the value of seeing everyone as a work in progress and transcending our provisional and limited judgments of them.
A snappy and inventive computer animated film whose clever storyline has something for everyone
A wonderful feel-good movie set in contemporary South Africa about dogs and dreams and love that warms the heart and lifts the soul
An engrossing family drama about the destructiveness of spiritual pride and the healing power of selfless love.
Shows in an odd and low-key way the absurdity of war and how Americans can be undone by their inability to wait.
A smashing performance by Judi Dench as an upper-class London widow who finds a new lease on life that arouses both her spirit and her spunk.
An enchanting screen version that breathes new life into Austen's classic novel, thanks mainly to a superb performance by Keira Knightley.
An enthusiastic man from New Zealand proves that age is no impediment toward fulfilling his dreams.
All about how Harry completes three difficult challenges and deals with the rollercoaster ride of adolescent emotions and energies.
movie_title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (2005)

movie_review_blurb: A spiritually riveting film about a nasty thug in a Johannesburg shanty town whose violent and selfish life is totally transformed.
One of the best films of the year with its special attention to the important role that our primal emotions play in life, love, and creativity.
A determined young Israeli man with a rare form of muscular dystrophy fulfills his dreams in a daring trip to America.
One of the best films of the year reveals the violence, the corruption, and the political chicanery involved in maintaining our addiction to fossil fuels.
