Spend some of the 525,600 minutes allotted to you this year with this soulful rock musical and it will speak passionately to the romantic and rebel within you.
Far too many scenes with unfunny pratfalls, fights among kids, and a pig that always seems to be center-stage.
A tedious, poorly acted melodrama.
Charts an experimental educational program that takes African-American boys from the ghetto streets of Baltimore to the wilderness of Kenya.
Shows how a small act of kindness, like a pebble thrown into a pond, can send out many ripples, and transform another's life.
A love story about two outsiders and their journey across America in search of self-respect and love.
A bewitching romantic drama set in London about love at first sight and the consequences of this sudden surge of love that defies all reason.
Here we go again with the tedium of yet another superhero who is faced with the daunting challenge of being a better parent.
A delightful and macabre family film that celebrates the naughtiness of kids as a cover for their playful creativity.
A funky and appealing Western parable directed by Sam Peckinpah.
Story of a young Filipino-American who returns to the Philippines and becomes the pawn of Muslim terrorist with a malevolent plan for him to execute.
An enigmatic Mexican film that captures the shadow elements in a marriage.
A harrowing film portrait of a ten-year old Irish Traveller whose life is constricted by poverty and prejudice.
An evocative and melancholy portrait of two men whose friendship has run its course.
An exquisite meditative journey inside a Carthusian monastery where silence is practiced as a way of honoring the mystery and the majesty of God.
A steamy Chilean drama about a young couple who spend a playful evening together in a motel and circle around the challenges of true intimacy.
An excessively melodrama story filled with cliches about writing.
A mesmerizing film about grief and some kids struggling to define themselves during adolescence.

Although a very serious subject, it is often approached with comedy. This one is more successful than a lot of television sitcoms have been in conveying the challenge and the rewards of the spiritual practice of openness.
A frolicsome adventure for kids that celebrates diversity, facing one's fears, and relying on each other in troubled times.
A compelling portrait of a 13-year-old homosexual struggling with his identity, alienation from his peers, loneliness, and sexual fantasies.
A light-hearted and breezy French film exploring the ups and downs of romantic love in the lives of two sisters.
The meeting of three women -- an American, an Israeli, and a Palestinian -- in Jordan and their struggle to overcome prejudices and their communal histories.
A relaxed and realistic portrait of four middle-aged women friends dealing with fragility of their lives and relationships.
One of the best movies of the year with its extraordinary depiction of plight of Indian widows and their yearning for liberation.
One of the best films of the year with its inspiring story of an eleven-year old African-American girl who claims her power with the help of 50,000 coaches.
Three cheers for a feisty, break-all-the-rules heroine who is a bold innovator in the grueling world of competitive gymnastics.
The film could have watered the seeds of fear and hate inside us; instead, we found our hearts going out to people everywhere facing incomprehensible events.
A sturdy, thought-provoking, and clever fable about Iran and the universal struggle to survive.
An unforgettable portrait of a Pakistani pushcart vendor trying to keep his soul alive on the congested streets of New York City.
Shows how dancing becomes a route to personal transformation for a man mired in mourning.
movie_title: Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing & Charm School (2006)

movie_review_blurb: Focuses in on a mother-son connection, rarely explored in films, after a depressed young man returns home to Indiana to start his life over again.
A pleasant 2-D cartoon for very young children about a frolicsome monkey who teaches a very serious young man about the pleasures of play.
This impressive documentary is Neil Young's trip down memory lane in an enchanting concert in Nashville.
A legendary love story set amidst violent clashes between English warlords and an Irish king fails to impress.
This high tech thriller starts out speaking to some hot topics in the headlines but quickly descends into a far-fetched crime drama.
Depicts the spiritual emergency of an amoral man in Mexico City who plunges into despair and turns to sex as a way out of his funk.
A compelling and deftly acted portrait of a female freedom fighter against the Nazi war machine in 1943 Germany.
A powerfully emotional film that will be taken to heart by animal lovers of all stripes.
A spunky and entertaining movie about two 13-year-old girls, a mermaid, and a quest for love and magic.
An extraordinary film about a miraculous occurrence of peace at Christmas in WWI when men laid down their arms and fraternized with the enemy.
A tribute to the focused and prophetic Native poet and activist who loves the Earth and has made many stands for the dignity of his people.
A frolicsome comedy about a 35-year-old who loves living at home with his parents; good chemistry between McConaughey and Parker make the romance work.
A light and breezy portrait of adolescence spiked with interesting observations on time, sexuality, and the search for meaning.
A truly inspiring documentary that depicts the salutary effects of prison inmates performing in an annual Shakespeare production.
A snappy satire about smoking, corporate shenanigans, and the spin that keeps everything rolling along in these amoral realms.
Has the quirkiness we've come to expect and relish in a Wim Wenders movie.
An engaging American drama about friendship as a curative force that can reach across the generations and transcend even racial barriers.
An imaginatively realized and well-acted Australian film about death, dying and grief.
A 12-year-old boy's initiation into the adult world where even those who seem virtuous are capable of giving into the enticements of money and power.
An extraordinary movie about power, amorality, ethics, and urban living, by director Spike Lee at the height of his talent.
An interracial love story that effectively conveys the challenges and the delights that face couples who choose to travel this path of intimacy.
A mishmash of a movie about a May-December romantic relationship set in New York City.
Scientific projects that probe the many mysteries of evolution.
movie_title: Where Did We Come From? Nova Sciencenow (2011)

movie_review_blurb: A strange romantic drama in which the three main characters are all losers in love.
A terrorist tale with a far-fetched storyline and finale.
Tedious and unfunny computer-animated film.
A scary and poignant documentary about the wall dividing Palestinian territories from Israel.
A hard-hitting documentary about the heated nature of the cultural wars in America and the hallowedness of free speech.
A gripping thriller that exposes the shadowy parameters of a war against the poor and the powerless that is animated by corporate greed and political amorality.
A sensitive treatment of a rancher's slow and often difficult process of forgiveness after years of hurt, anger and disappointment.
An unsettling psychodrama that opens our hearts to a mentally and emotionally troubled man.
A gripping supernatural thriller about the continuing clash in our society between the forces of reason and science and the forces of faith and religion.
This black comedy's mean-spiritedness comes in one size that fits all.
A mishmash of a film that flies off in far too many different directions.
A seventy year old man from New York City travels across the country and discovers the joy, the confusion and the stoutness of the human adventure.
A delightful oddball German comedy about a retired mine worker's musical quest.
The first film in a projected trilogy by the Greek filmmaker Theo Angelopoulos is visually stunning but lacking in emotional firepower.
movie_title: Trilogia: To livadi pou dakryzei (The Weeping Meadow) (2004)

movie_review_blurb: A sprightly version of Oscar Wilde's witty play Lady Windermere's Fan that is filled with clever lines on the complications of sex and marriage.
A quirky coming-of-age film about a confused adolescent and his parents who are experiencing their own mid-life crisis.
A light-hearted and pleasing romantic comedy about two individuals who reach out in the mystery of their relationship and discover new life.
A bittersweet fairy tale set at death's door that salutes the liberating power of true love.
An exceptional portrait of a samurai warrior who is a nurturing male.
A flimsy film about a serious and sober young man who travels to the Ukraine to find out about the woman who saved his Jewish grandfather from certain death in 1942.
Natasha Richardson in an intense performance as a passionate woman who risks all to satisfy her desires.
A mesmerizing documentary by Werner Herzog about a young man obsessed with grizzly bears in the Alaskan wilderness.
A grim and powerful depiction of the long day's journey into night experienced by a couple kidnapped by a trio of angry young men from the ghetto in Caracas, Venezuela.
A disaster flick about a group of New Yorkers trapped in the Holland tunnel.
An abused young girl finds sanctuary in the care of the women of her extended family.
A noir thriller about greed.
A celebration of the marvels which lie behind and beneath the world we call familiar.
A fresh, funny, and abrasive film about three high school seniors.
A crowd-pleasing exploration of Shakespeare's most melodramatic potboiler.
Speaks volumes about urban alienation and sexual politics.
A sense-luscious triumph with its exquisite dancing, music and songs.
Intregrative medicine explained.
A bittersweet tale of redemption that conveys the power of cinema and the soulful dimensions of storytelling.
An unusual documentary about the countercultural guru.
An aesthetically appealing anatomy of loneliness and aloneness by a Japanese filmmaker with a keen eye for the nuances of human nature.
A lively picaresque tale of two down-and-out buddies struggling to survive.
Love blooms when we least expect it to and we must be ready for it with open hearts and a willingness to step into the dark.
A derivative and unappealing comedy about superheroes and their sidekicks in training.
Recycled Top Gun thrills with three hot-shot pilots and a rogue American droid fighter plane.
A lively romantic comedy, grounded by John Cusack as an intense idealist with wit and a big heart, about the role of Internet match-making services in the dating game.
A heartfelt story about a teenager who proves that ordinary individuals can do extraordinary things through strong intention and a little help from their friends.
Provides an anatomy of a middle-aged burned-out man who is led unwillingly to a place where he can get in touch with his feelings.
Hits the mark as an exploration of a woman who gives away her gold to others and must find a way to acknowledge her own genius.
A riveting morality play about the slippery slope of deception and the folly of dividing the world simplistically into those who are good and those who are evil.
A forceful documentary about the first executive director of the Sierra Club who was also a first-rate environmental crusader.
A hard-hitting and involving morality tale about the thief in the heart of a greedy young man.
An endearing portrait of a transvestite whose playful ease in the face of one harrowing experience after another makes him into what the Taoist sages call "a disciple of life"
A witty and wonderful clay-animated comedy that is a charmer from start to finish with its two endearing antiheroes and its clever puns and wry references to other movies.
movie_title: Wallace & Gromit: The Curse of the Were-Rabbit (2005)

movie_review_blurb: Based on a short story by Joseph Conrad, here is stylized rendition of a foundering marriage of convenience.
The 1950 classic arrives on DVD for the first time with its charm enhanced and plenty of extras to delight fans of the fairytale.
A convincing German morality play about the Nazi's amoral worship of strength and power.
A rollicking comedy about a famous novel, movie-making, and the wild chaos of life that frustrates the sober-minded while generating gales of laughter in playful individuals
movie_title: Tristram Shandy: A Cock & Bull Story (2005)

movie_review_blurb: A sharp-edged thriller about the refusal of privileged members of the winning class to trust others or to take responsibility for their actions.
Explores the heartache of two gay cowboys who incarnate the basic human needs for wholeness, fulfillment, and a true love who accepts you as you really are.
An endearing tale of a depressed young man who in the midst of career failure and a death in the family discovers the zest for life.
A morality play about the pervasiveness of sports gambling in America.
Puts a face on the anguish of the poor during the civil war in El Salvador during the 1980s when twelve year old boys were drafted and required to become murderers.
Traces the often imperceptible connections that punctuate our lives and the disconnections with others that cause endless pain, disappointment and loss.
A compelling drama set in a 1989 Minnesota mining community where the misogyny and chauvinism in the workplace will make your blood boil.
Might just as well be called Forty Shades of Boredom.
A steamy thriller about celebrities misses the mark with its lack of interesting characters.
A shocking documentary on the greed, violent colonialism, and genocide brought on by King Leopold II, who raped the Congo of its resources.
movie_title: Congo: White King, Red Rubber, Black Death (2003)

movie_review_blurb: The attention Nolan gives to the characters and the storyline brings Batman back into focus as an inventive heroic figure.
A delightful documentary that shows how creative expression is a necessity in the lives of urban children.
Watch a beautiful horse serve as a miracle worker for a dysfunctional family devoid of hope.
movie_title: Dreamer: Inspired by a True Story (2005)

movie_review_blurb: An enticing drama with real emotional firepower about two estranged sisters and the long, hard road they must take to re-connect with each other.
Van Sant tries too hard to make some meaning out of Kurt Cobain's hazy and crazy last days.
A powerful and imaginative documentary by a courageous Israeli filmmaker on ways to imagine our way into the psyches and the souls of Palestinian suicide bombers.
movie_title: Avenge But One of My Two Eyes (Nekam Achat Mishtey Eynay) (2005)

movie_review_blurb: An engrossing psychodrama about Hollywood, sex, and the primal emotions that can drastically change people's lives.
It is something special in these times of incivility to see a protagonist who stands apart from others with his good manners.
Insights into the desperate plight of those Palestinians who feel that living under oppression is hell and that dying is preferable.
A sad and scary film about the ignominy of dying alone in a hospital room surrounded by strangers and without dignity.
A low-key drama set in a working-class Midwest town that zeroes in on the dangers inherent in jealousy - a strange brew of hostility and attachment.
A stirring tribute to television journalist Edward R. Murrow's courage and conviction in a dark period of American history.
A superlative performance by Philip Seymour Hoffman as the famous writer whose need to be special manifests itself as both entertaining and deeply disturbing.
A racking film which explores divorce with sensitivity and artistic skill.
An open house that allows us to enter and freely share in the emotional upheavals of all the characters in this dysfunctional family.
Jodie Foster doesn't impress in this lackluster thriller that is far-fetched and uninvolving.
Psychologically involving film that illuminates the thin line between love and manipulation
movie_title: Schwestern oder Die Balance des Glücks (Sisters Or the Balance of Happiness) (1979)

movie_review_blurb: This adorable comedy will appeal to all those who loved and experienced giddy feelings during "A Little Romance."
A slow-moving and austere look back at the activities of some young participants in the events of May, 1968 in Paris.
A morally provocative meditation on race in America and the troubles that can come when democracy and freedom are crammed down the throats of others.
There is an endearing fluidity to this Korean film about the interplay between movies and life.
A flawed and unimpressive meditation on violence.
A hypnotic and intense masterwork on grief, the afterlife, and the yearning of the soul that can turn darkness into light.
movie_title: Through the Forest (À travers la forêt) (2005)

movie_review_blurb: An American working-class youth takes on an immensely talented Englishman in the 1913 U.S. Open and surprises everyone.
A lively and clever sci-fi feature with colorful characters and a villain that is far more than the usual cardboard cutout.
An extraordinary documentary about injustices rectified and innocent men set free after years in prison.
A woefully bad teenage love story overflowing with melodramatic touches that are excessive and unbelievable.
An adventure story about a boy and a creature he raises who just might be the Loch Ness monster.
movie_title: The Water Horse: Legend of the Deep (2007)

movie_review_blurb: A quirky but deeply spiritual movie about an awkward and unhappy man whose journey to self-acceptance is riddled with obstacles of his own making.
Opens our hearts and minds to the special place musicians play in the Kurdish culture and the ways in which they celebrate the human spirit.
A dreadful romantic comedy with characters that talk claptrap and trivialize love.
A well-acted horror story with a sophisticated screenplay that, unfortunately, waters the seeds of violence, prejudice, and speciesism within us.
A candid and troubling documentary about a working-class family in upstate New York whose lives have been deeply altered by violence.
An appealing documentary about a larger-than-life adventurer, artist, entrepreneur, and social activist in a settlement in the middle of the Sahara.
An oddball family drama with idiosyncratic characters and a handful of surreal scenes.
A sturdy and sensitive drama about the Civil Rights movement in Oxford, North Carolina, in 1970; it rings true and reveals the scourge of American racism in all of its ugly manifestations.
New York-based love story that illustrates how old-fashioned virtues can still play a significant role in matters of the heart.
A top-drawer political thriller that is timely, sophisticated, and well-acted.
An engaging romantic love drama that morphs into a deeper and richer consideration of the truly transformative power of love.
A creative and unsettling documentary that reveals how yearning can be both a burden and a blessing to those caught in its grasp.
An unusual and compelling documentary featuring eight thinkers musing on philosophical matters as they walk in creative places.
A riveting documentary that speaks volumes about art, private collections, painting masterpieces, and the power plays of the rich and the elite.
A road movie about three travelers in post-Katrina Louisiana and their quest to avoid a bleak and dark future.
An exotic adventure tale about a young woman's trip to an alternate reality and the testing of her will power, resourcefulness, and courage in the face of weirdness and danger.
A stunningly beautiful animated feature from Ireland centered around The Book of Kells and the fire power of faith wedded to imagination.
A slam-bang thriller set in Iraq in 2003 which vividly illustrates that truth is the first casualty of war.
An impressive romantic drama set in New York City about a young woman's sudden plunge into loneliness and what she learns from this sad and melancholy emotion.
A romantic drama about the tender bloom of love in a garden of death, grief, and great loss.
A powerful and poignant drama about Lourdes, miracles, faith, grace, and the mysteries surrounding cures that go beyond reason and explanation.
The back story to the political and economic landscape of our times and the reasons why the rich are getting richer and the world is in such a mess.
A poignant drama set in the tense multi-ethnic community in Jaffa, Israel, where dreams are regularly shattered by violence, poverty, and religious strife.
Probes the greatest miracle of all: the difficult process of turning enemies into friends.
movie_title: For My Father (Sof Shavua B'Tel Aviv) (2010)

movie_review_blurb: An elegant costume drama about the early years of Victoria, the longest reigning Queen in English history.
A really dumb romantic comedy with the trendy storyline of someone falling in love with somebody who has been betrayed.
movie_title: Did You Hear About the Morgans? (2009)

movie_review_blurb: Moments of razzle-dazzle delights but somewhat disappointing.
A morality tale about the consequences of making deals with the devil that has some visual flare but doesn't really hold together.
A romantic comedy in which Meryl Streep, but not the audience, laughs a lot.
Arthur Conan Doyle's legendary bloodhound of justice given a less than awesome makeover.
A Southern melodrama from an unproduced screenplay by Tennessee Williams that should have stayed unproduced.
movie_title: The Loss of a Teardrop Diamond (2009)

movie_review_blurb: An oddball adolescent goes on a wild quest to lose his virginity and to find true love with a seductive and mysterious young woman.
A touching spiritual drama about a cynical man and his auspicious relationship with a wise Senegalese brother and his beautiful sister.
An interesting documentary about the last large sheep drive in Montana with cowboys who are not romanticized
An emotionally affecting documentary about the amazing animal rescue operation after Hurricane Katrina and the desperate quest of dog guardians who return to New Orleans to find their beloved pets
A post-apocalyptic thriller with Christian Fundamentalist messages.
It's a shame to see the talented actress Amy Adams floundering around in such a lame and unfunny romantic comedy.
An intense film about the messy coming-of-age misadventures of an angry and unhappy English working-class teenager.
A gritty and tough depiction of a young petty criminal's introduction to the ways of the world while serving a six-year prison sentence.
A complex and well-acted French film about lying and other deceptions that bring dark clouds and bad weather into the lives of the characters
movie_title: The Girl on the Train (La Fille du RER) (2010)

movie_review_blurb: An inspiring drama about a man who possesses great perseverance, a spiritual character quality that includes patience, flexibility, and resilience in the face of challenges and constant change.
A portrait of Charles Darwin and all the tensions in his life that just manages to drag us down and wear us out.
An alluring documentary about the shocking power and mystery of lightning in human experience.
An original and endearing romantic comedy about a difficult person who is trying to get unstuck from his bad habits, cynicism, and fear.
An extraordinary German documentary about 12 adults with disabilities created by the toxic drug Thalidomide and how a special project lifts their spirits and gives them a fresh sense of community.
An immensely entertaining film about family secrets and the many roles we play in our private and public lives.
A battle of the sexes comedy that is ludicrous and scattered.
An extraordinary film about adoption and the lives of three very different women on separate quests for love, nurturing, and personal fulfillment.
A delightful and thoroughly appealing documentary that charts the adventures of four babies from the U.S, Japan, Mongolia, and Namibia.
A thought-provoking documentary on the toxic spin-offs from both Al-Qaeda and the U.S. War on Terror.
A fascinating documentary about the high regard for insects in Japan and the cultural and spiritual reasons behind this phenomenon.
A rousing and well-acted screen interpretation of the backstory of Robin Hood before he became a heroic outlaw and champion of the poor.
Queen Latifah shines as an avid New Jersey Nets fan and an accomplished physical therapist who opens herself up to love and true adventure.
A fetching romantic melodrama with a delicious performance by Vanessa Redgrave as an elderly woman on a quest for love.
A tribute to the power of friendship to help pull us through crises and problems which are often too hard to handle ourselves.
An astonishing film about the struggle of a Kurdish immigrant to get from Calais to England and the assistance he obtains from a middle-aged Frenchman who empathizes with his dreams.
A heroic tale about the Hawaiian royal heir battling against the unsavory greed and raw power of American imperialism.
Unusual portrait of a Nazi and German businessman who is known in China as a living Buddha for saving 250,000 citizens of Nanking during the Sino-Japanese war.
A delightful animated portrait of Shrek's mid-life crisis and his struggle to find a way to savor the ordinary rhythms of marriage and parenting.
A riveting drama about the plight of a 60 year old who seeks to avoid death and stay forever young.
An intelligent and beautifully acted French film about work, death, grief, and finding one's way back to life.
movie_title: The Father of My Children (Le pere de mes enfants) (2010)

movie_review_blurb: An exquisite and well-acted French film about an extramarital romance which opens two lovers to fresh territory inside themselves they never explored before.
A degrading portrait of women through an unfunny story about four Ugly Americans abroad.
A swords and sandals extravaganza that flounders early on and never recovers.
movie_title: Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time (2010)

movie_review_blurb: A tedious and unappealing portrait of the obsession of a middle-age architect to write a play.
One of the best films of 2010 which transports us to a place we've never been before and impresses us with the importance of hospitality and openness to the other.
An emotionally affecting film about a young man whose good heart transforms the life of angry bar owner.
One of the best movies ever about guilt as the guardian of our goodness and a sign of our yearning to belong to the larger world.
An appealing romantic comedy.
A long and drawn-out Swedish crime-drama.
movie_title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo (2009)

movie_review_blurb: An immensely appealing drama about the extraordinary love and devotion of a dog for his beloved human companion.
An elegant and thought-provoking drama about sexual yearning.
A drama about grief, creativity, and the supernatural as expressed in the lives of a volunteer at a literary festival and a novelist who writes about ghosts.
An astonishing documentary about a young male ballet performer from Cambodia who has startled and amazed the dance world with his bold leaps and incredible grace.
A wonderful and enchanting animated film about a 13-year-old girl's initiation into adulthood through her adventures in a strange city.
A Star Wars-like animated feature about a legendary city behind the clouds and the many secrets it holds about nature, robots, light, and magic.

One of the best animated films ever made for families: it celebrates feminine sensitivity, the importance of the spirit world, respect for nature, and the pre-eminence of the spiritual practice of kindness.
An exquisite and engrossing documentary on the profound and playful life and work of dance legend Anna Halprin.
Sinks in its own excessive melodrama.
An underwhelming blend of mythology and action drama.
A funny film about the crazy adventures of a bored suburban couple in which they rediscover their love for each other.
A fascinating documentary about the amazing rollercoaster ride of Jim Morrison and the Doors who tried to break on through to the other side.
Another behind-the-scenes look at the formation and success of Chess Records in Chicago during the 1950s and 1960s.
A combination psychological thriller and love story that offers an engrossing look at memory, yearning, and the toxins of revenge; winner of the 2010 Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film.
movie_title: The Secret in Their Eyes (El Secreto de Sus Ojos) (2010)

movie_review_blurb: A sophisticated drama about love and literary matters skillfully and sensitively directed by James Ivory.
movie_title: The City of Your Final Destination (2010)

movie_review_blurb: A tribute to the courage and creativity of Tehran's underground indie-bands and their rebellion against a law forbidding them to play rock music.
movie_title: No One Knows About Persian Cats (Les Chats Persans) (2010)

movie_review_blurb: A satire that pokes fun of the ruses that corporations are willing to undertake in order to get more people purchasing their products.

A very creative and poignant animated film about the heartbreaks experienced by a Hindu goddess and a contemporary woman who share the universal pain and sadness that accompany the end of an intimate relationship.
A snappy, humorous, and creative comedy about an ambitious pre-teen boy whose expends all his energy trying to win the approval of his middle-school peers.
An enchanting Irish adult fairy tale about love, redemption, and healing.
An emotionally affecting drama about the birth of compassion in an Iraq war hero assigned to work for the Casualty Notification Office.

A thematically rich and imaginative sci-fi masterpiece that gives us a cosmology totally in sync with contemporary spirituality movements -- reverence for the Earth as a living being and Oneness consciousness celebrating the interconnectedness of all.
An oddly affecting drama offers much food for thought on the after-effects of adultery and the toxin that can wither our soul when we are overtaken by jealousy.
A creative animated film set in a post-apocalyptic wasteland where a courageous soul goes on a quest to discover meaning.
A funny and bawdy fable that playfully deals with community, a battle between the sexes, the preciousness of water, and the joy of young love.
Depicts how a woman U.S. marshal at a frigid station in Antarctica is tested on many levels by a murder case.
A spellbinding story of true love written and directed by Jane Campion that showcases Abbie Cornish as an accomplished actress.
A visual valentine to Paris and an enchanting dramady about a group of strangers whose lives mysteriously interconnect.
A multi-narrative film that explores the challenges of coming to terms with the past and putting it behind us.
A powerful and disquieting film about racism, sexism, and the hope for reconciliation in post-apartheid South Africa.
A dynamic and dramatic documentary about the David vs. Goliath dimensions of the "Amazon Chernobyl" case where indigenous tribal groups are fighting the multinational corporation Chevron.
Another creative addition to Steven Soderbergh's impressive collection of adventuresome films.
Michael Moore's hard-hitting documentary about the egregious, toxic, and rapacious spin-offs from the American obsession with unbridled capitalism and greed.
A bittersweet glimpse of the early life of the legendary French fashion icon Coco Chanel.
An engrossing documentary on the life and music of the man many consider to be the most important composer of all time.
A rare achievement for a romantic comedy -- bringing us to a closer and deeper sensitivity to the sharp edges of honesty and the ways in which deceptions can both heal and harm.

A thought-provoking spiritual original by the Coen Brothers that salutes the mystery of God, the futility of seeking answers, and the need to live as best we can in a sea of roiling troubles and uncertainties.
An impressive performance from Clive Owen as a single dad who tries to connect emotionally with his two sons and learn from his mistakes.
A spunky coming-of-age dramady about roller derby that boasts another stellar performance by Ellen Page.
An emotionally poignant film about a degraded and abused African-American teenage girl whose life is turned around by the love and concern of an inspiring teacher and the compassion of others.
movie_title: Precious: Based on the Novel Push by Sapphire (2009)

movie_review_blurb: An ill-conceived dramady about love and grief.
A fragmented but fascinating glimpse of the famous German terrorist group and their violent legacy.
movie_title: Der Baader Meinhof Komplex (The Baader Meinhof Complex) (2008)

movie_review_blurb: A parabolic Argentine film about a woman who proves that the rich can get away with murder.
movie_title: La Mujer sin Cabeza (The Headless Woman) (2008)

movie_review_blurb: An appealing drama revolving around a cross-country journey and a boy's quest to understand and appreciate his mother.
Sobering drama about a poor Albanian woman living in Belgium and trying to keep her head above water in hard times.

Yum! One of the Best Films of 09 with its celebration of culinary creativity and the spiritual practice of enthusiasm as the energy which animates the efforts of two women to give their best to the world.
A mesmerizing Turkish film about the mysteries of human nature.
A bold and creative science fiction adventure that shows the dire consequences of hating strangers and ignoring the spiritual practice of hospitality.
Explores with emotional intelligence an elderly woman's passionate love affair and the ways it transforms her life.
A fine historical survey of the environmental movement in America from the 1950s to the end of the 1980s.
A charming and enchanting mystical fairy tale about a goldfish who becomes a girl and a little boy who loves her and introduces her with pride to his world of wonders.
A dreary and poorly paced romantic drama with too many unintentionally laughable lines.
The bold and courageous activities of volunteer eco-warriors to save whales in Antarctic waters from being illegally slaughtered by Japanese fishing fleets.
movie_title: At the Edge of the World (2009)

movie_review_blurb: A laid-back, colorful, and groovy glimpse of the magic of Woodstock viewed through the life of an up-tight young man who is a great caretaker unable to treat himself with the same care and support he gives others.
Film version of a fresh and spunky Broadway musical about a young black man's quest for self-understanding and creative expression.
A poignant and emotionally gripping drama about two men locked in the past and given a chance to reconcile with each other after many years of inner torment and anger.
An appealing bittersweet drama about a Japanese family get-together that explores sibling rivalry, the need to be loved and appreciated, and the mysteries of death.
A heart-affecting documentary about six American women who are mourning the death of their children and take a healing adventure together to serve others in South Africa.
A riveting and multidimensional examination of the subprime mortgage meltdown and its devastating impact on homeowners from poor African-Americans to wealthy Californians with swimming pools.
A bold and astonishing documentary about the daunting and enlightening ecological project of a radical idealist and his New York City family
We could care less about the characters in this dreadfully bad comedy.
Aims for the quirkiness of Little Miss Sunshine and misses by a mile.
A dreary and bizarre drama filled with cynicism and darkness.
A depressing tale of a couple whose relationship is running on empty.
A rambling story of a down-and-out country singer (a fine performance by Jeff Bridges) trying to put his life in turnaround.
Clever and hard-hitting attacks on the dishonesty, greed, and ethical malfeasance of corporate America.
movie_title: The Yes Men Fix the World (2009)

movie_review_blurb: A dark and foreboding film about the seeds of anger, violence, and hatred in the home that can lead to war and the rise of fascism.
A wonderful feel-good fact-based sports story about the gifts of nurturing love and a redefinition of family values.
Vividly captures and conveys the intense yearning of a teenage girl and her desperate desire for the deep intimacy of love.
Focuses on the strong and universal desire of both the rich and the poor for a loving connection with their children and the obstacles which can hinder that intimacy.
A self-reflective melodrama about filmmaking and revenge.
Probes the midlife crisis of a caregiver who must decide what to do with her life when no one needs her anymore.
movie_title: The Private Lives of Pippa Lee (2009)

movie_review_blurb: A funny and appealing coming-of-age drama propelled by a razzle-dazzle performance by Christian McKay as the legendary boy-wonder Orson Welles.
A post-apocalyptic tale that is nothing more than an ad for patriarchy and dualistic thinking.

A powerful Inuit film about the wisdom and skills of elders, the devastation wrought by contact with Westerners, the importance of community, and the magical connection between grandparents and grandchildren.
movie_title: Before Tomorrow (Le Jour avant le lendemain) (2009)

movie_review_blurb: A satisfying romantic drama with two alternate stories and a remarkably fresh and vibrant performance by Lynn Collins.
A riveting drama about a Marine captain who brings the violence of the war in Afghanistan home to his wife, two daughters, and brother in America.
A laid-back drama that gives us a close encounter with a lonely man whose desire animates his life in a new and adventurous direction.
A glimpse into the last year in Tolstoy's life and a provocative depiction of the different shades of love in the lives of some creative people.
One of the Best Films of 2009 with a bright, sassy, and relevant story about home, connections, unemployment, technology, and traveling light.
A dreadful and unappealing comedy about a couple whose marriage is in jeopardy.
An astonishing and incredibly entertaining movie about the power of forgiveness, the importance of sports, the art of transformative leadership, and the reconciliation of the races.
A world-weary college professor hobbled by grief and confused about his own future, discovers the joy and pleasure of small things and magic moments.
A dull holiday animated feature set in New Orleans with bland characters and an uninventive storyline.
Misses the nuances and emotional hub of the bestselling novel by concentrating on the crime and psychedelic shots of heaven.
A richly developed dramatic comedy about parenting, family secrets, and the toxic fallout from high expectations and pressure to succeed advanced by so many well-meaning fathers.
A hard-hitting documentary that presents the voices and concerns of the poor along with suggested ways out of the abyss between the rich and poor.
A tedious dramady about an unappealing group of women in Los Angeles.
Spectacular special effects and one of the dumbest screenplays of the year.
Might be funnier with several rum punches in hand.
Unfocused and uninteresting documentary about the famous hotel for bohemians of all stripes.
A delightful French film by Alain Resnais which explores middle-age malaise, chance, limerence, and the impulsive risks some people are willing to take to explore their wildest desires.
A slow-paced, philosophical, and thought-provoking Romanian film about a cop with a conscience.
An austere and powerful French film about the dangers of religious zealotry and the mysteries of divine grace.
A haunting, innovative, and poignant film about childhood that may have you howling with the Wild Things inside and around you.
Eleven short films exploring love, the ties that bind people together, and the manifold mysteries of human nature.
A sensuous, astonishing, and memorable film about the different shades of love in sexuality, friendship, and marriage.
movie_title: Le Chant des Mariées (The Wedding Song) (2008)

movie_review_blurb: Portrays a time-starved mother who is willing to throw herself into parenting but also realizes the need to care for her own soul.
A biodrama about an extraordinary woman aviatrix who followed her passion and blazed a trail for others to do the same.
Gives conscience a good name and proves the world needs more women warriors to uphold the cause of justice.
A powerful and poignant drama set in South Africa about the toxins of racial hatred and the terrible after-effects of the dangerous and destructive passion of zeal.
A quirky and clever movie about the oddball adventures of some psychic spies dedicated to nonlethal combat.
movie_title: The Men Who Stare at Goats (2009)

movie_review_blurb: An ethically rich drama about the mystery of not knowing, greed, responsibility, free will, and altruism.
An intense and powerful portrait of a stubborn 80-year-old man who is struggling with letting go of his attachment to an idea and to a place he loves
A garish and tedious animated interpretation of the Charles Dickens classic that has neither heart nor soul.
A gorgeously filmed documentary that takes us to 23 countries and conveys the diverse paths to God in the world's major religions.
A raucous and robust comedy about a rebellious band of deejays whose love for rock-n-roll spurs them to defy the British government in the late 1960s.
A delightful and very clever stop-motion animated screen adaptation of a Roald Dahl children's tale about a charming, smart and cunning fox and his quest to be true to his animal nature.
An enticing romantic drama with an assured and sexy performance by Jess Weixler.
A sprightly family comedy about a frisky Great Dane and his human companion who both learn new things during a major transition in their lives.
An extraordinary documentary about three smart, intense, and talented teenagers in the Intel Science Talent Search.
A portrait of doctors doing the best they can in hellish circumstances that shows them as more human and heroic than ever.
movie_title: Living in Emergency: Stories of Doctors Without Borders (2010)

movie_review_blurb: The ambitious Mexican director Alejandro González Iñárritu boldly explores one man's encounter with death and his yearning to provide a legacy for his children.
A mesmerizing film about the self-destructive and dark dimensions of perfectionism and unbridled ambition.
An over-the-top and out-of-the-box movie about a creative conman's quest for true love.
A robust and sprawling drama about a genuine romantic whose pursuit of true love leads him on many adventures and escapades.
A riveting screen adaptation of a Pulitzer Prize-winning play about grief and the invidious ways it can rock the foundations of a marriage.
A powerfully effective documentary on the astonishing life and democratic vision of Pakistan's first female prime minister.
A sensitive anatomy of a sexual affair by Silvio Soldini, one of Italy's most gifted directors.
This boxing film has us rooting for a working-class hero who struggles to find his style in the ring and outside the ring within his dysfunctional family.
A deft and down-to-earth anatomy of love and loneliness by Mike Leigh, one of England's legendary directors.
A remarkable and rowdy documentary about a contemporary holy fool and saint who walks his talk about love, compassion, peace, and transformation.
movie_title: Saint Misbehavin': The Wavy Gravy Movie (2010)

movie_review_blurb: A Hollywood actor and celebrity's close and intimate encounter with his 11-year-old daughter spurs the need for a change in his life.
An entertaining and feisty Western from the Coen Brothers propelled by an incredibly fetching performance by Hailee Steinfeld as a wise beyond her years teenager with indomitable will-power.
A chilling anatomy of a marriage beginning and ending.
A gripping movie that graphically portrays poverty as the worst form of violence in the life of a 17-year-old heroine struggling to save her family.
A top-drawer documentary about the gifted and prolific protest singer and songwriter Phil Ochs who marched to a different drummer during the 1960s.
movie_title: Phil Ochs: There But For Fortune (2011)

movie_review_blurb: An extraordinary portrait of a positive and meaningful father-son relationship that touches the heart.
Well-acted story of an ex-con struggling to make a fresh start and finding that the people in his new life are creating roadblocks.
A morality play about friendship and telling the truth that fizzles into a sour and tedious comedy.
A fast-paced and spunky depiction of the power-plays, greed, corruption, and grandiosity of GOP lobbyist Jack Abramoff, a larger-than-life wheeler-dealer.
A wonderful animated feature that salutes the power of healing and the spirit-lifting miracles of light.
The three young wizards on a quest that will test their loyalties, courage, and magical abilities to the max.
movie_title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows - Part 1 (2010)

movie_review_blurb: A soul-searching and brilliantly-acted Czech drama that plunges us into a confrontation with our own ideas and feelings about memory, idealism, and forgiveness.
A convincing and inspiring political thriller about the destructive power of dirty tricks and the spiritual power of moral courage.
The engrossing story of three Algerian brothers and their responses to French violence and injustice after World War II.
A thought-provoking documentary about what really lies behind the crash and burn downfall of New York's Governor and former Attorney General who took on Wall Street as a crusading reformer
movie_title: Client 9: The Rise and Fall of Eliot Spitzer (2010)

movie_review_blurb: The remarkable, funny, and inspiring true story of women fighting for equal pay in a Ford Motor Company in 1968 England
The battle between love and hatred for Arabs in one Jewish family in Jaffa.
A riveting and creative wilderness story directed by the inimitable Danny Boyle about a loner and his courage and perseverance in the face of hopelessness.
A funny road movie that brings together an angry architect and a laid-back aspiring actor on a cross-country journey.
Involving story about a college graduate trying to make her way in the world while living at home as a full-fledged member of the 'Boomerang Generation."
A delightful drama about an aspiring chef who is lifted by the wisdom and craft of an Indian mentor, a Zorba the Greek-like character.
A fascinating documentary on Gary Snyder's adventures and his importance as a sage with much wisdom to pass on to us.
Entertaining and enlightening probe of the Cold War and its impact on Estonia through the "soft power" of pop culture.
movie_title: Disco and Atomic War (Disko ja tuumasoda) (2010)

movie_review_blurb: Three cheers for two working-class heroes who put their lives on the line for people they don't even know.
A compelling thriller directed by Paul Haggis on the ethical decision of a husband to break the law in order to right an injustice to his wife.
The ardent quest of a lonely and accomplished young man with Down syndrome for normalcy and intimate love.
A meditative drama that explores in rich and rewarding ways the luxury of solitude in the lives of two strangers who both love being alone.
An enthralling and heart affecting biodrama about an unusual friendship that transforms the life and soul of King George VI of England.
A hard-hitting and creative examination of the scourge of unemployment and how it destroys dreams, brings untold pain and loss, and destabilizes families.
A bittersweet and well-acted drama set in 1976 about two African-Americans in Philadelphia forced to come to terms with the ghosts of their past.
A crowd-pleasing documentary about the adventures of a wild Red-tailed hawk in New York City where he enchanted hardcore urban-dwellers and stole their hearts.
An unrelentingly depressing drama about a family drenched in disappointment, despair, anger, and loneliness.
The last installment in the Millennium series of Swedish films reveals the dangers of zealots in high places of power and prestige.
movie_title: The Girl Who Kicked the Hornet's Nest (2010)

movie_review_blurb: An engrossing drama about the difficulty people have believing in forgiveness or in turning one's life around.
A comic look at hooking up and the ideal of just having fun.
A satisfying spiritual love story about the preciousness of free will and the lengths some human beings will go to be with their soul mate.
A poignant drama about the universal appeal of violence in our psyches and in cultures around the globe.
A romantic comedy set in California in 1988 that loses its focus.
An inventive and fertile screen adaptation of Charlotte Bronte's 1847 novel.
A thought-provoking romantic drama about the mysteries of love and the formidable challenges of marriage.
An unusual and fascinating documentary about the survival of avant-garde art in the Soviet Union thanks to the courage, imagination, and zeal of one collector.
A flat, uninvolving, and annoying sci-fi and 3D animated film
Touching story about the emotional uplift of music, the tenderizing of a family member's heart, and a father-son reconciliation like nothing you've ever seen before; one of the best films of 2011.
From start to finish this is a wonderful and immensely creative animated film about a loser who arises to the challenges faced in a town without water.
A frolicsome comedy in which two Englishmen encounter a smart, witty, and gifted extraterrestrial on their pilgrimage to famous UFO sites in America.
An emotionally satisfying drama about sports, family, and money problems in which everyone gets a second chance. One of the Best Movies of 2011!
Drama about a long day's journey into night and catastrophe in 2008 as high-ranking members of a prosperous financial firm deal with its imminent collapse.
A well-crafted and realistic look at the shameful and humiliating treatment of illegal immigrants in Belgian detention centers.
A beautiful Turkish film about a six-year-old boy and his encounters with the adult world of mystery, beauty, and loss.
An engrossing look at the impact of social, political, and cultural change on five Russians from the last generation brought up behind the Iron Curtain.
A substantive Canadian film revolving around trips made to the Middle East to confront family secrets and a glimpse of the dehumanization of war.
A grim and focused anatomy of anger carried into our hearts and minds by two intense performances by Peter Mullan and Olivia Coleman.
An excruciatingly long one-note film, filled with sickening and senseless violence, about a misanthropic oil man and an ego-filled minister.
A courtroom drama about a wheeler-dealer defense attorney caught in a tight squeeze that tests his ethical integrity.
An exquisite sixteenth-century tale of love, passion, jealousy, and beauty from consummate storyteller and master mood-maker Bertrand Tavernier.
movie_title: La princesse de Montpensier (The Princess of Montpensier) (2011)

movie_review_blurb: A delightful French comedy about a trophy housewife who becomes a transformative leader.
A mesmerizing Thai film about death, reincarnation, and the abundant mysteries of the human adventure.
movie_title: Uncle Boonmee Who Can Recall His Past Lives (2011)

movie_review_blurb: A World War II prison break, survival, and morality tale about the power of forgiveness as an ideal to animate a lifetime.
An engrossing South Korean morality play about the power, amorality, and the warped sense of entitlement of the very rich.
A supernatural thriller with Anthony Hopkins as a seasoned exorcist who introduces a young priest to the mysteries of not knowing.
An intense and soul-stirring German film about misogyny, tradition, reconciliation, and one Turkish woman's quest for independence.
Poignant portrait of a mother dealing with her grief over the death of her infant daughter and struggling with the need to wall herself off from those closest to her.
A 3-D thriller that misses the mark thanks to a mediocre screenplay and undeveloped characters.
A documentary with a varied group of Americans talking about solutions to the very-real crisis of climate change.
A rollicking comedy about the transformation of a sheltered and insecure insurance salesman while attending a convention.
A whimsical documentary about the elderly comedian Jonathan Winters and his quest to have his paintings exhibited at the Museum of Modern Art.
A sword-and-sandals drama that hammers home the virtue of honor but then goes around the bend.
A depressing and senselessly violent film noir from Argentina.
A bold, creative, engrossing, and spiritual documentary about a rational woman's close encounter with death that changes her life and perspective.
An extraordinary documentary about a fierce and creative wild lioness in Botswana who is doing all she can to nurture and defend her cubs as they face one challenge after another.
A deeply human and spiritually enlightening French film about the mission of seven Catholic monks serving a poor Muslim community in Algeria. One of the best films ever made about Christian life!
A creative and risky blend of a character-driven drama and a documentary about some alienated working-class people in a slummy suburb of Baltimore.
A mildy engaging identity loss thriller set in Berlin
A drama that the late Howard Zinn would appreciate about filmmaking, water rights, ancient Spanish imperialism, and modern-day exploitation of the poor.
A stylized and compelling portrait of the fever of romantic love in all it stages from immediate attraction through the yearning for reciprocation.
A memorable documentary on the mysterious life and creative spirit of the Canadian pianist Glenn Gould.
movie_title: Genius Within: The Inner Life of Glenn Gould (2010)

movie_review_blurb: An enthralling movie set in Bombay about the dreams and desires of four very different people.
Stands out as one of the best documentaries ever made about the important transition of leaving home, a tricky and complicated stretch of time for parents and their offspring.
A road movie that charts the adventures of an orphan teenager as she experiments with sexuality, marriage, and adultery.
A character-driven movie about grief, depression, and the way out of both of them through love.
A three-part exploration of a family's life in a mining town in western China.
The drama brings Mikael and Lisbeth together again as they team up to uncover the corruption and power plays of unethical men who view women as the weaker sex. Lisbeth again proves them wrong.
movie_title: The Girl Who Played with Fire (Flickan som lekte med elden) (2010)

movie_review_blurb: An engaging and well-acted Irish film about two pre-teens who escape their oppressive life in a slum for an adventure in the city of Dublin.
Mixes arcane talk about dreams with traditional action sequences resulting in strange and ineffective hybrid.
An impressive action-thriller that pulls out all the stops.
An explosive and thought-provoking plea to abolish nuclear weapons before they abolish us, as President John F. Kennedy once stated.
A riveting French film about a Russian patriot whose espionage activities in the 1980s changed the destiny of his country and the world.
A robust and snappy documentary about Ron Galella, the controversial photographer of America's superstars and celebrities.
A spunky 3D animated feature that shows how a supervillain can follow his heart and be transformed from within.
A moving drama about an Iraq war veteran suffering from PTSD and the soul loss he experiences.
One of the Best Films of 2010 with its authentic, telling, and moving depiction of the difficulty of forgiving ourselves.
A very funny comedy that also contains some insights on the spiritual exercise of dealing with difficult people.
An important ethical documentary about the Cambodian genocide, a major Khmer Rouge leader, and some of the farmers who followed orders and killed hundreds of men, women, and children.
A gripping and powerful Israeli antiwar movie that vividly conveys how no war is ever over no matter when the troops withdraw.
A tense and well-acted drama of a kidnapping which draws together the daughter of a rich man and her two captors yearning for the freedom they think money can buy.
A 1947 English film classic about the challenges of desire faced by some nuns in a new mission in the Himalayas.
A music-based biopicture about a female hard-rock band that paved the way for many others by proving that chicks can play as well as the guys.
A romantic drama and morality tale delivered with simple clarity and clout by the immensely gifted Portuguese filmmaker Manoel de Oliveria.
movie_title: Eccentricities of a Blonde-haired Girl (Singularidades de uma Rapariga Loura) (2010)

movie_review_blurb: A wonderfully quirky character-driven drama about friendship, sexual desire, and being a true gentleman.
A remarkable family drama with five endearing characters whose struggles and foibles are both genuine and touching.
Snappy and fast-paced.
A transitional time in the life of a 35-year-old ad agency executive when he has a chance to take a hard look at his life.
An unappealing comedy about uninteresting people in the music business.
A mishmash of a romantic comedy with one of the weakest and most unbelievable scripts of the year so far.
A sci-fi thriller that starts out fine but then descends into preposterous developments.
A well-done and emotionally affecting remake of the popular 1984 film about a boy whose life is transformed by learning kung fu from a master teacher.
A stylish story of the passionate intimate relationship between two formidable creative individuals in 1920s Paris.
A darkly comic drama that honors the mysteries surrounding human nature, the complexity of intimate relationships, and the bounties of friendship.
A stylish and erotic Italian drama about the sensuous and sexual awakening of a middle-aged trophy wife.
An expose of the Mormon Church's involvement in an anti-gay crusade fueled by hatred and a rigid defense of family values.
A fine family film with an edifying tale, endearing and funny characters, and an appealing emotional undertow.
Tom Cruise and Cameron Diaz on a wild and suspenseful ride.
Oliver Stone's interviews with seven Central and South American leaders whose personalities, programs, and ideals have been vilified by the U.S. media.
A sporadically funny comedy about sex, lies, and the dream of being forever young.
A bizarre and gross tale of family values, home schooling, and isolation from the world.
A drama about complex matters of the heart and chivalry with Edward the vampire exemplifying a knight's bravery, courtesy, honor, and skill at arms.
A documentary revealing the diversity of talent and subject matter in the wide world of films.
A hackneyed drama in which even Helen Mirren can't make much out of her bewildered character.
A wonderful documentary about two young talented black ballet dancers from working-class families and the yearning that propels them.
This gripping French film written and directed by Claire Denis vividly conveys the tensions, barbarity, and violence of civil war in Africa.
Life During Wartime is an oddly touching drama about three unhappy sisters and those in their orbit.
A zany and wildly creative comedy about the ups and downs of young love.
A satisfying and searing satire on the plight of poor farmers in India and the lack of sympathy or understanding of them by the rich and the powerful who have their own plans for national progress.
A sad and poignant drama about a new generation of Palestinians trying to make their own way in their shackled world of loss, persecution, and anger.
movie_title: Salt of This Sea (Milh Hadha al-Bahr) (2010)

movie_review_blurb: A sensuous and emotionally cathartic adaptation of Elizabeth Gilbert's spiritual journey to personal transformation and love.
Another edifying movie by Oliver Stone on the ethical disarray, selfishness, and cynicism of those who worship at the altar of capitalism.
A fresh and funny exploration of the close encounter of two brothers who have been estranged from each other for two years.
An astonishing morality tale about the shadow side of creativity, the loneliness of pioneers, and the ways in which anger can fuel ambition and power in a world ruled by technology.
Stephen Frears' spiffy comedy of manners about infatuation, envy, jealousy, and adultery.
Succeeds in provoking thoughts about ethics, pop culture, and human nature, and that isn't an easy thing to do.
A wonderful family film about the greatest race horse who ever lived that gets out of the gate quickly and impresses with its big heart and idiosyncratic characters.
A soulful and spirit filled German film about the extraordinary 12th century abbess, writer, teacher, music composer, herbalist, prophet and visionary.
movie_title: Vision: From the Life of Hildegard von Bingen (2010)

movie_review_blurb: A brave and illuminating documentary about a landmark 2003 nonviolent protest movement in a small Palestinian town against Israel's Separation Barrier.
A snappy and funny performance by Katherine Heigl is the best reason to see this romantic comedy
A lean and intensely focused spiritual drama about faith, the dark night of the soul, and the redemptive power of love.
movie_title: Letters to Father Jacob (Postia pappi Jaakobille) (2010)

movie_review_blurb: The incredible true story of a crusading sister and the love that animates her to devote eighteen years of her life to free her brother from prison.
Offers a critical assessment of a corrupt political tool exploited by both Republicans and Democrats.
A spunky comic action drama about a colorful band of old timers called out of retirement to help an old buddy, a former CIA agent.
A poignant, meditative, meaningful, and commendable movie about the afterlife from the uniquely gifted Clint Eastwood.
A poignant documentary about the death of an American idealist working for the liberation of the Palestinian people and peace in the Middle-East.
An incredibly informative and emotionally moving documentary about the challenges and new developments in our understanding of autism.
movie_title: A Mother's Courage: Talking Back To Autism (Sólskinsdrengurinn) (2010)

movie_review_blurb: A spiritually rich Mexican drama about a Jewish woman's death and the experiences of her inner circle of family and friends.
An astonishing documentary about a daring art project in the world's largest garbage dump in Rio de Janeiro that celebrates the pickers who labor there.
An amiable and philosophical French film about the intimacy of marital love, the art of crime detection, and the confession of a dark family secret.
A serious and sobering documentary about reforming American education and taking bold steps in new directions with charter schools where excellence is heralded and love of learning a given
Vividly conveys the sorrow and suffering brought into the lives of five individuals by a man with a gun and his act of random violence.
A magical movie about a five-day stay in a psychiatric hospital that gives a depressed fifteen-year old a new lease on life.
movie_title: It's Kind of a Funny Story (2010)

movie_review_blurb: A passionate depiction of a middle-aged woman's awakening to her long dormant erotic desires.
A dynamic and captivating bio-drama of a gifted young ballet dancer from communist China and his quest for respect, love, and a new life of freedom.
A funky comedy about an oddball restaurant owner in Hamburg whose creativity and perseverance are tested in an unending series of mishaps and setbacks.
A poignant documentary that puts a human face on the plight of 130 million migrant workers in China who are pawns in the global marketplace.
A scathing and troubling documentary about a high-level military cover-up and a huge propaganda effort by the American government and media to garner support for the war in Iraq.
A spiffy romantic comedy about secrets, friendship, love, nurturing, and the human race.
A French film about the messy and perplexing dimensions of mid-life crises and the different ways people deal with them.
movie_title: Change of Plans (Le Code a Changé) (2010)

movie_review_blurb: An endearing story that follows the obsessions and frustrations of first love.
A troubling Peruvian film about how violence lingers in the minds, bodies, and souls of its victims.
movie_title: The Milk of Sorrow (La Teta Asustada) (2010)

movie_review_blurb: J.R. Ackerley's masterpiece memoir about his loving relationship with his dog has been made into a funny, charming and witty animated feature.
A compelling French drama that deals with a transitional period in the lives of two people whose encounter with each other leads to fresh starts.
An astonishing documentary about the dire effects of the Chinese occupation of Tibet and their efforts to obliterate this nation's special cultural traditions.
A bold film that covers fresh ground and impresses with George Clooney's bravura performance and the rich moral material explored in the story.
An incredible South African road movie and comedy about love, friendship, honesty, and the common ground that can unite former enemies.
A mildly entertaining sports flick about a girl's basketball team and a chauvinistic coach who knows a lot about the game.
One of the Best Films of 2010 which revolves around the intimate relationship between two sad, lonely, and frightened individuals looking for love.
A wonderfully crafted coming-of-age drama about the love that can heal the brokenness of an estranged family.
A totally beguiling Swedish film about the coming-of-age of a 10-year-old girl during a summer when her parents and brother are gone.
A smart and savvy documentary about online relationships and the things that draw people together or pull them apart in cyberspace.
A sassy and funny movie that gives imagination, pluck, and creative playfulness a good name.
Explores in a winning way the familial strife and other forces which helped forge the creative genius of John Lennon.
A mixed bag comedy about a celebrity who seeks meaning in his life after finding out that he has a terminal illness.
A visually sumptuous Italian drama about the shadow side of power-hungry leaders and lovers who tell themselves stories that have no resemblance to reality.
Not even the delightful Katherine Heigl can save this flubbed romantic comedy from its ludicrous depiction of a woman who hands herself over to a macho man for a makeover.
A playful and light-hearted screen version of the popular Broadway musical which is carried by the snappy and happy songs of Abba.
An extraordinary documentary about a talented African-American, a garden of exquisite beauty and love, and a community that has been brought to life by his artistry, enthusiasm,and generosity.
A sophisticated and well-acted screen version of Evelyn Waugh's 1945 novel about the toxic fallout from a Catholicism of sin, sacrifice, guilt, and otherworldliness.
A compelling and subtle documentary about Philippe Petit's sensational walk on a wire between the World Trade Center Twin Towers in 1974 and the missteps he made on earth afterwards.
A compelling supernatural thriller with Scully and Mulder peering into the darkness and trying to fathom the inexplicable.
movie_title: The X-Files: I Want to Believe (The X Files 2) (2008)

movie_review_blurb: An immensely appealing documentary that enables us to empathize with five very different teenagers in their last year of high school in Warsaw, Indiana.
A hard-hitting documentary about the negative fallout from America's obsession with physical perfection.
A consistently surprising romantic drama which beautifully conveys the bittersweet qualities of contemporary dating.
movie_title: In Search of a Midnight Kiss (2008)

movie_review_blurb: A thought-provoking morality tale about the descent into darkness of a vigilante superhero, an anarchistic and sadistic villain, and an ardent idealist whose dreams are shattered.
A sprightly English comedy about a very special Bar Mitzvah, World Cup Fever, and the frantic efforts of a 12-year old boy to get the attention he feels he deserves.
A well-acted screen adaptation of a short Philip Roth novel about the multiple splendors of beauty in a chilly world of intellect, sex, and selfishness.
Charts the difficulties four young women have in keeping alive their friendship and the ritual that animates it.
movie_title: The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants 2 (2008)

movie_review_blurb: A wild, raucous, and wacky stoner action-comedy about three losers whose scary encounter with death and danger bonds them together in ways none of them could have ever imagined.
A delightful drama about the wine business and the yearning of three unfulfilled men to reach their potential.
An action comedy with unappealing characters and a fast pace that can't cover up its cynicism.
A deeply spiritual movie about miracles, hope, love, and living in the present -- one of the best films of the year.
A breezy romantic comedy from Woody Allen about the different shades of love.
One tedious battle scene after another.
A mediocre Hollywood movie with a trite message about civic responsibility.
Story of two lovers trying to stem the tide of gloom and doom in a Thai town devastated by the 2004 tsunami.
An exploration by French director Claude Chabrol of the illusions of love in the magical worlds of publishing, the media and old money.
movie_title: La Fille Coupée en Deux (The Girl Cut in Two) (A Girl Cut in Two) (2008)

movie_review_blurb: A dreary drama about a group of selfish and amoral characters whose lives intersect in Los Angeles.
An incredibly creative docu-fantasia that explores the memory, history, dreams, and myths of his Canadian hometown.
A poignant and well-acted drama about the trouble some people have accepting the kindness and good fortune which comes their way.
An impressive thriller which acknowledges the mystery that lies behind the marvels and the terrors of the natural world.
A spunky and delightfully silly screen adaptation of the classic-cult television series.
A poetic and sensitive drama about a Bangladesh village girl's life in England and her valiant struggle to stand on her own in the world with a full and grateful heart
Fizzles as a comedy and as an exploration of the stresses of work.
A messy movie filled with too much juvenile humor.
A superb family film set in the Depression era that salutes the spiritual values of openness and hospitality in the face of class prejudice.
The transformation of a fear-based man by a Zorba-the-Greek-like woman with a zest for life, enthusiasm, and creative daring.
The tender and touching story of a lonely robot on Earth who falls in love and becomes a spiritual teacher to all who encounter him.
A floundering action comedy with an interesting premise that self-destructs in its second half.
An oddball buddy movie about a friendship betweeen a lonely teeenager and a therapist undergoing a mid-life crisis.
A classy and sophisticated French murder mystery that is well-acted.
movie_title: Ne le Dis à Personne (Tell No One) (2006)

movie_review_blurb: An edifying documentary about prostitutes who want to leave "the life" behind.
Will appeal to the freak inside you who refuses to follow orders and is not afraid to let your gentle side out every once in a while.
A cautionary tale about the acute discontent and loneliness that comes from a constant craving for new and exotic experiences.
An entertaining family film in 3D about adventures in a strange and wondrous world.
movie_title: Journey to the Center of the Earth (2008)

movie_review_blurb: A flawlessly directed drama about an Italian couple's life together in love that is besieged by unemployment and the drastic downsizing of their lives.
An outsider adolescent sinks in a sea of troubles in this wobbly comedy.
A robust and ribald picaresque tale told with comic élan and philosophical panache.
movie_title: I Served the King of England (2008)

movie_review_blurb: A gritty portrait of the struggles of a Chinese food deliveryman in Manhattan.
A thriller with many insights into terrorism and the agencies committed to stem the tide of violence.
A clever black comedy that pokes fun at some of the obsessions of our frantic times including surveillance, cosmetic surgery, and physical fitness.
A far-fetched conspiracy story that depicts the growing and pervasive role of technology in our lives.
A romantic drama that is plagued by artificiality.
Three Army soldiers on the road in America bond together through a series of preposterous happenings that come across as silly.
A visually stunning coming-of-age drama set in the vast barrenness of southern Kazakhstan's Hunger Steppe.
A powerful family drama that reveals when forgiveness is hard, compassion is a healing balm.
Celebrates one man's arduous and lonely crusade against injustice; it's a story the honors his courage and zeal.
Salutes the vision that sees invisible things, cares for others, and refuses to abandon hope.
A dim comedy about kids who just want to have some fun.
A World War II story of four black soldiers that is lifted above its confusing subplots and multiple characters by two magical moments of compassion.
A live concert featuring three Muslim comedians building bridges of understanding through humor.
movie_title: Allah Made Me Funny: Live in Concert (2008)

movie_review_blurb: A lengthy and complex portrait of Che as a revolutionary, a leader of a guerilla band, a doctor, a believer in obedience and loyalty, and a man willing to suffer for his beliefs.
A compelling and poignant anatomy of an over-the-hill wrestler's encounter with the excruciating pain and isolation of loneliness.
Directors Joe Swanberg and Greta Gerwig fill the screen with many magical moments of intimacy in a relationship that is going through a rough patch.
A sturdy sports flick about the legendary Ernie Davis who was the first African-American to win the Heisman Trophy.
A thriller that reveals the latest twists and turns in the war on terrorism.
A remarkably heart-affecting screen version of the deeply spiritual novel by Sue Monk Kidd about the healing and transforming power of love.
A combination road movie and teen sex comedy that is totally predictable fare.
A depressing and bleak drama about two brothers in Thailand.
Opens our hearts to the excruciating anguish of parents of missing children and the continuing terrible mistreatment of women by men in positions of power and authority.
A gritty drama based on a bestselling Italian novel about organized crime that focuses on the lives of five different players in the System.
A startling and creative contemporary fable about some of the drastic changes that are rocking the traditional understanding of work and family life in Japan.
A well-wrought Korean film about a middle-aged painter's infatuation with a pretty young art student.
One of the most original and daring films of the year that puts us in the skin of a pretty 13-year-old Arab-American and the challenges and dangers brought into her life by her budding sexuality.
A pleasant coming-of-age story about an enthusiastic young woman who learns how to change her tidy life plan and to go with the flow.
An enlightening documentary about the global war over water and the progress being made by activists against multinational corporations and their campaign of privatization.
A poignant French film that shows the mysterious power family secrets can have upon our lives and how we see the world.
Trite and boring portrait of rich and self-absorbed women.
A bleak and morally meaningless cop flick.
A shooting star of a movie with awesome beauty in its characters, in the natural world, and in the cycles of creation and destruction depicted in the emotionally affecting drama.
An emotionally powerful drama with the potential to build bridges of understanding between gays and the Religious Right.
Three cheers for this prophetic political film about activists willing to take a stand against rich and powerful multinational corporations.
A heart-affecting drama about a beautiful 18th century woman imprisoned in a cage of wealth and privilege.
Sensitively explores the chilly reunion of a Chinese father and his American daughter who dance around a divisive family secret.
movie_title: A Thousand Years of Good Prayers (2008)

movie_review_blurb: A hilarious comic fantasy about ghosts, misanthropy, and a spiritual take on sneezes.
A nasty neighbor movie that fails to engage us.
A depressing film that celebrates brute strength as the only means to stem the tide of violence and crime in Rio de Janeiro.
A rounded and revealing portrait of a French teacher in a multiracial Parisian school and the challenges he faces in the classroom.
A compassionate account of an enterprising young woman on her way to Alaska to find work who falls into peril due to a series of unforeseen circumstances beyond her control.
A harrowing glimpse of the steely resolve and commitment to freedom of IRA leader Bobby Sands who starved himself to death in prison in 1981.
One of the best portraits of an enthusiastic person ever put on the screen.
A dysfunctional French family learning that `it is never too late to bring love, peace and healing into a divisive and unforgiving household.
movie_title: Un Conte de Noël (A Christmas Tale) (2008)

movie_review_blurb: A dreadful romantic comedy with totally unappealing characters.
Three cheers for a crazy wisdom hero who wants to make the world a kinder, gentler place!
movie_title: You Don't Mess With the Zohan (2008)

movie_review_blurb: Transports us to the faraway past and an exotic place where a legendary warrior is forged into a fierce leader through suffering and hardship.
A sensitive and compelling exploration of a troubled father-son relationship whose universal themes will connect with many adults.
movie_title: When Did You Last See Your Father? (2008)

movie_review_blurb: Predictable dance melodrama with little to recommend it.
An underwhelming political thriller.
Starts off well but then tries to replicate the fast-paced frenzy of The Bourne Ultimatum with an improbable car chase.
A comedy hobbled by a preposterous plot and a phony finale.
Depicts the efforts of a Russian Jew to survive a Nazi concentration camp with his creativity and chutzpah.
How a proficient practitioner of seduction tries to ensnare a Napoleonic general in her web of coquettishness in 1820s Paris.
movie_title: The Duchess of Langeais (Ne Touchez Pas La Hache)(Don't Touch the Axe) (2007)

movie_review_blurb: A poignant and heart-affecting film about a 12-year-old Latino street orphan who is one of the many poor in the forgotten America.
let freedom ring!
More flare is needed to make us care about these characters who swoop, spin, and glide.
A heartfelt drama about a grieving woman who embarks with her two best friends on a pilgrimage across the West seeking meaning and closure.
A disappointing costume drama.
An adult fairy tale that is badly hobbled by its uncreative handling of its theme of finding one's true self.
Three women trying to cope with the complexities of love and loss, but it's all been said a thousand times before.
An effervescent romantic comedy that sparkles and delights.
movie_title: Miss Pettigrew Lives for a Day (2008)

movie_review_blurb: A salute to the courageous and caring work done by military doctors and nurses in Iraq, Germany, and the United States.
